review_title: An improvement from his earlier films, but not enough.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Incredibly bad
review_detailed_main:
The fact that this is directed by Uwe Boll serves as a warning - this is going to be craptacular. And craptacular it is. Plot is all over the place, direction is basic and performances are hammy, at best. The whole thing is laughable. Not that it is funny: this isn't one of those dramas that are so bad they're good because they end up being reasonable comedy - this is so bad it stays bad.

The fact that the cast includes many big/biggish names might fool you into thinking that this may be worth a watch. However, in many ways they're an indicator of the low quality, a mixture of has-beens and never-wases. The presence of Matthew Lillard is surely an indicator of a very weak movie. I feel sorry for John Rhys-Davies as he far too good for this sort of crap.

Avoid.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: An Improvement
review_detailed_main:
Having seen House of the Dead and Alone in the Dark I only rented this to give further credence to my hatred for Uwe Boll . . .

However, instead of what I expected I saw a decent fantasy story, assembled in an acceptable, albeit inexpert way. The first point of note is the choice in editing. Simultaneous action scenes spliced together are common in this genre. The quiet scenes occasionally also spliced in do not fit and would be better placed afterwords, or before, by themselves. The restraint of emotion in certain scenes is in poor decorum for the material covered, typically with our heroic members. Contrastingly, Liotta and Lillard are jarringly insane, to the level of Shakespearean madness, without the decent dialog to back it up.

The number of characters makes the development far too sharp (I already just used "jarring"). Honestly this would have probably been better as a mini-series.

The point that I must make though is this: this film is decent enough as entertainment to receive detailed criticism. It is only a few solid points off of being good. It is far short of the epic that a $60Mill budget would demand, but still acceptable.

Filmamker is showing improvement.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: How do you make such a bad movie?
review_detailed_main:
I, like other reviewers, expected this to be a bad movie and as such was braced for a subpar film. But I figured with Jason Statham, Leelee Sobieski, Ray Liota, Ron Perlman, Clair Forlani and Jonn Rhys-Davies that there would have to be some redeeming qualities. There were not.

This sinkhole of a movie was like 5% Lord of the Rings and 95% Power Rangers. The fights were ridiculous and the bad guys were in rubber suits. I just do not know how this movie actually made it to the screen. You think at some point someone would have screened it and realized that this much suck in the same movie just needs to be put out of its misery. This is the first review I have written on IMDb and am only writing it in the hopes that you can avoid this movie.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Dosen't look like the typical Boll movie.
review_detailed_main:
OK, let me get something clear. House of the Dead was ridiculous. I was so angry when Boll Butchered Bloodrayne(one of my favorite video game) and was even more angry when the sequel came out, even with the beautiful Natassia Malthe as Rayne the movie was 3 time worst than the first one that was really awful, so you imagine what I'm saying.

But here we are with this movie, honestly i rented it because i always liked these kind of movie(Troy, Dark Kingdom: The Dragon King, Tristan + Isolde) are all movies i liked. And Jason Statham was in it so it couldn't that bad. I was not expecting much because its a Uwe Boll movie.

But then i watched it and i was like...huh its really a Uwe Boll movie? I liked it, I'm not saying its my favorite movie of all time, but i really enjoy it and didn't have the impression it was a Boll movie(they always look cheap with terrible acting and poor special effect) I was greatly surprise and the only big complain i could put on it was that it was not very violent, a lot of slashing with swords etc and still not much blood sadly. But the storyline was nice, character where good, i will say it, I DID ENJOY THIS MOVIE even tough its directed by Boll. Of course it won't excuse him for these horrible Bloodrayne movie but a least he will have do one nice movie.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: review by tpaladino
review_detailed_main:
obviously never going to be as good as LOTR (any of the 3) but i would take this persons review more seriously if they could spell the directors name correctly, especially seeing as they could get it from the top of the page.

it's a Jason Statham film without a car let alone a car chase maybe there will just be a lot of horse power.

some good names (Ray Liotta and Burt Reynolds) that you can never go wrong with, however i haven't actually watched it so i could be wrong.

I only posted this cos tpaladino's comment annoyed me!!

San Dimas College Football Rules

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: How does Uwe Boll do it?
review_detailed_main:
How does Uwe Boll do it? I mean, how does he convince well know actors with real stage and screen credits to act in one of his god-awful films? Blackmail? Coercion? Pictures of their loved ones tied to chairs and being forced to watch BloodRayne over and over again? Ron Perlman's and John Rys-Davies' talents are sadly wasted here. Never mind the fact that Ray Liotta is better than this! And certainly Burt Reynolds (whom you youngsters may not know was an Oscar nominee in his day) is better than this! And talented actors they all are, so this is definitely not their fault. With good material and good direction these actors can handle anything.

Which brings us back to the point I'm trying to make. The direction is not just wooden, it's lame - and I'm guessing Boll's "vision" for the film was phoned in - long distance - even during the final edit. Though I can't see how even a great editor could have saved this mess from becoming schlock. He just wouldn't have any competently directed scenes on film to work with!

Maybe Uwe Boll's films make money in non-English speaking countries where no one can tell that the dialog is trite and the acting is stilted. No, not stilted, smothered - by the kind of mis-direction that wouldn't be acceptable in an undergraduate film class. But that's still no excuse. So please, somebody, anybody, get the dirt on Mr. Boll so we can find out how he does it -- and stop him before he does it again!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: I can't believe how awful this is.
review_detailed_main:
Let me state for the record that I love movies, and I watch movies all the time. Fantasy, drama, horror, suspense, romance, sci-fi, you name it. This is one movie that I just couldn't watch all the way through. I knew this movie wasn't going to be that great, but man was I OVER-estimating this pile of crap.

Horrible, horrible directing to good actors makes, for one movie at least, horrible horrible actors. Ray Liota should have NEVER done this movie. Same for Statham. LeeLee, well, she's not really that great an actress in the first place, so...

John Rhys-Davies : I am saddened by your choice to be in this movie. You are one of my favorite actors, and you have just put the worst credit of your career into the books.

The music was just god awful. Same with the costumes, especially the goblin-wannabes. The most obvious rubber suits I've seen since black and white movies.

I don't normally comment on movies, but this one is just crap garbage. Uwe needs to be thrown out on his ass and black listed from EVER doing movies again. I mean, c'mon. How the hell do you bank roll the WORST director ever? Look at his history. Bomb after bomb after bomb. The deusche bag hasn't had a real money maker since, well, NEVER!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Wow this is bad... Do not watch...
review_detailed_main:
I was channel surfing and decided to check out this "Dungeon Siege" thing, since I played the game. I wasn't expecting anything, since most movies that come from games are bad.

After a few minutes of it, I decided to move on, it was as bad as I expected to be. But then I saw Jason Statham, Ray Liotta, Burt Reynolds, and other recognizable actors. Given that it's the quality of a B movie, I was really surprised to see the class of actors they were able to get. I was intrigued by this and somehow sat through the rest of the movie. But unfortunately it never improved beyond bad.

A bad director can make ANY actor look bad. This was a very amateurish film, and without the charm of a B movie. I thought it was funny that Uwe Boll would proudly display his name after the movie was done. Maybe he actually thought this was a great movie, something to be proud of?

Don't waste your time with this movie.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A waste of a good evening
review_detailed_main:
This movie was recently on Dutch television and got some pretty high recommendations because of the cast, but sadly the cast performs very poorly in this particular movie. Although the actors are trying to make the best of it, the script and the overall story is terrible. It's incoherent, poorly played and absolutely unconvincing.

What bothered me especially, was the score of the movie. The music was sometimes way over the top for what happened on screen and it also was a complete LOTR rip-off at times (When farmer is first introduced for example).

Dialogs are poorly acted and battles tend to be repetitive and the scenes are way too long.

The only reason why I don't mark it a 1 vote is that the visual effects are pretty nice at times but it doesn't make up for this garbage.

A waste of my evening.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A so-so movie.
review_detailed_main:
I'm also a huge fan of fantasy/medieval-type movies however this one seemed to leech off all original work from Excalibur"http://imdb.com/title/tt0082348/" To the Lord of the Rings"http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0120737/" To include the primary combat scenes between the two major factions in the movie. However, the selected cast was well done and all of the actors and actresses played the parts very well.

However. One thing that completely caught my eye was the ending music tracks during the closing credits. Blind Guardian and Hammerfall. Two of my favourite metal bands whom I needed to order on import to receive here in the states. I applaud whomever selected those particular tracks.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Could have been a whole lot worse
review_detailed_main:
Well, this is only the second Uwe Boll movie I've seen (the other being Bloodrayne) and I can see the pattern. I had hoped that maybe Bloodrayne was a crap-luck situation, but no; the other reports are dead-on. This movie, though, was BY FAR better than the other. Here's my take:

First, the acting. Let's just get it out of the way right now: there really wasn't any to speak of whatsoever from half the cast. The actors were just reading the lines. A couple of the others were over-the-top all the way through--Ray Liotta and Matthew Lillard (hope I spelled those correctly, sorry if I didn't). The only one who came close to not sucking was John Rhys-Davies; he was not bad (that's the best I can give him for this one). The rest--pathetic, and it's ALL Boll's fault.

The action, though, was pretty good. Lot of mixed genres in there--Western-style martial arts, Midieval, Kung Fu, fantasy. Thing is, it was all done well. The actors were physically on par, and the choreography was really well done.

Also, kudos to the special effects guys. The costumes, weapons, effects, etc., were all high caliber and creative. That crew gets points for doing their job right.

Last but not least, the plot. Not completely sure what to say here. Not horrible, but not that memorable either. So I guess the plot is just fairly ho-hum.

Final judgment: if you want some mindless violence, watch it. Turn the sound off while they're talking or just fast-forward to the battle sequences. The rest, forget it. And feel pity for the actors that they had to suffer under Boll's lack of ability to direct.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: somewhat entertaining
review_detailed_main: I don't get it why people hate Uwe Boll movies so much, ever since "Tunnel Rats" I think he's capable of making good ones. When people like flicks like "Braveheart" then they like this one, too. Or so I thought. To me there isn't much difference. This is not some low budget movie as you maybe would except it from Uwe Boll. Sometimes there are good actors involved but their acting is really poor in that particular movie but that's not the case here, either. Moreover you might think that this kind of story is too much of a predictable one but I don't think that applies here. There are well made and entertaining battles and great actors which makes this movie worthwhile watching if you're into this kind of stuff.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not that bad
review_detailed_main:
I can't believe the number of ones in the ratings. The average rating of 3,8 is ridiculously low. However, I'm not rating it a '10' like others might have in order to compensate...

The movie wasn't that awful as some comments might want you believe, especially if you enjoy fantasy movies in general. It obviously lends a lot of the elements of LOTR (or maybe I should say the game it's based on does, but I've never played so I wouldn't know). Editing isn't that good, CGI was OK and the acting was reasonably well done. The story was the familiar good against evil with a lot of battles going on. Dialogues were not memorable. A bit too flawed to rate it a '6', but altogether an enjoyable movie if you feel like nice, shallow evening of entertainment.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Possibly the greatest movie ever made.
review_detailed_main:
I went to this movie expecting the worst, because of Uwe balls previous work i was a little hesitant, oh how i was wrong, the story is about a man named "farmer" who has to run around all day killing people to save his beloved wife, oh how he loves her so very much. you will never forget the courage, the bravery, the love in this film. not to forget the special effects and dramatic action, Uwe bell has truly changed the way i will look at life, and I'm certain he will do the same for you. Hollywood will change because of this film, the impact it has on you, oh dear lord thank you, thank you for everything! be sure to take all your friends and loved ones to see this movie, I'm sure after the 2 hours 30 minuets they will thank you.

thank you Uwe Bull, for your outstanding directing skills and ability to spend money wisely.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Entertaining.
review_detailed_main:
It is not top quality Hollywood material by a fair distance. But it's beyond a TV movie for quality - the actors are good (not close to Oscar performances but they do the job) and the effects would have been good for 2000AD. And the action sequences would have been good for pre matrix days.

The fact that the film is not up to high budget modern standards, and that it is based on a video game, and that the main guy is called 'Farmer', and that it bombed on the box office, and that it the plot (like most fantasy) is heavily influenced by lord of the rings, that the director has a bad rep for buying film rights and funding his projects with German Government tax rebates, does not stop it from being a fun film to watch.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not even Leelee could save this one
review_detailed_main:
To be quite honest I watched this film only because Leelee Sobieski is so smoking hot - but I was also curious to what this Boll character is all about. From what I known he is almost religiously frowned upon on these forums.

I was not very happy about this piece of work. Strangely some well known and quite decent actors (notably John Rhys-Davies and Jason Statham) was lured into this project - and their performances are pretty much all the quality this film has to offer.

Scripting and directing is, at best - on par with an episode of Xena The Warrior Princess. The editing is even worse, with strangely cut pauses in dialog and music breaks that clearly does not fit in. Special effects are clear-as-day CGI, but that is to be expected from a low budget flick. Also on the technical side I couldn't help to notice that some scene were notably blurry, with poor colors and also strange blurry panning - almost as the direct view recording (or whatever it's called) was used instead of the main camera at some points.

To sum things up, if you decide to watch this despite all the warnings - make sure to have a couple of drinks handy. At least that would help you laugh at some of this, or even better put you to a calm sleep.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Probably Uwe Boll's best

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: plagued
review_detailed_main: This movie has some pretty good visuals, and Owe does a decent job of directing the script....but to me thats the problem. The script is weak; and besides Jason Statham and Ron Pearlman, the acting is horrible. Not just a few glitches horrible, I'm talking about Ben Affleck horrible. Over and over again I felt like I was watching a fantasy nightmare. Burt Reynolds as the King??? Matt Lilliard as a Prince??? Ray Liotta as a poor man's Sauron? To think that a movie studio would pony up the money to finance such garbage is unbelievable; maybe I'll have a chance to be a screen writer if this is what Hollywood has to succumb to. OK, I got it...."Lethal Weapon 5," starring Clay Aiken.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Uwe Boll
review_detailed_main:
I watched this movie not knowing it was a Uwe Boll film. After seeing how bad it was, I was relieved to find out it was one of his.

I should stipulate that I'm not a fan of Jason Statham movies. Guy Ritchie kicked off his career with two fantastic films; Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, and Snatch. After that, someone made the mistake of letting him decide his own fate, and he's pumped out a trash load of crappy action films that are meant to stroke his balding ego.

That said, I was bored on a weekday, and this film came on, so I went ahead and watched it. And, as most Uwe Boll films do, it did not disappoint to disappoint. It's flat out horrid. It's so bad, you think it could finally bury the devastatingly bad acting career of Statham. Unfortunately, that's not the case, as he's managed to churn out some of his worst films since; Death Race and Transporter 3.

The point is, if you're look for the Bizarro world version of a Kubrick/Scorsese-esquire directing career, Uwe Boll is your man. He has made multiple video game-based movies, for f'ing sake! Only a director bent on a career of the most disappointing movies man has ever seen could use as his visionary light a 1990's video game. Bravo, sir, I could drunkenly drool out a better premise.

Uwe Boll, if you're reading this, please do something else with your life. Like postal work. Or landscaping. At least the damage you would do to someone's grass would only ruin the lives of one household.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Unused scenes from Lord of the rings
review_detailed_main: It appears as if all bad and unused ork scenes were compiled to this film. Unbelievable that some really good actors could be convinced to act in this movie. No need to watch.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Was hoping for at least 5 minutes of entertainment. Found 10 seconds..

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Why all the hate ?
review_detailed_main: I enjoyed this very much, I don't understand all the one stars I really don't. Jason provided action in a genre where we usually lose out. I am not sure what all you 1 star people were hoping for. Yes the characters could have been more developed. However that is difficult to do unless you are going to put it into an already known genre/realm (lotr) and spend a lot of money and over three films on it. Précis I enjoyed it, you haters need to chill out. As far as I am concerned anything that entertains me is a win, I find myself entertained. To let you know where I stand, Eragon (as a recent reviewer mentioned) was not entertaining, like sticking every good book I had read and putting it in a blender.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Well, at least he's figured out how to stage a battle sequence now...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A Great action adventure - A Big screen Movie of Knights and Kings!!
review_detailed_main: The screening blew me away - What a GREAT movie! This is a Big Screen winner. If you liked the Lord of the Rings saga this movie is bound to revive you. It is an adventure and some. You must see it - indeed you must stay tuned for Jan 2008 and get ready for an adventure!! The movie takes you back to a time we have all dreamed of a time of knights and kings, great courage and noble deeds, wizardry and black magic. based on the popular video game Dungeon Siege the remake of the game is astounding. A must see really!! It is a movie for the whole family to watch but you have to see it on the Big screen the CGI is fantastic but not overdone, it really is the action that just never stops. Complete with amazing performances from the legends of film, the likes of Burt Reynolds, Ray Liotta, Jason Stratham, Mathew Lillard, Ron Perlman, Will Sanderson and the super HOTT Kristanna Loken!!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: We can't all be Peter Jackson, but so what?

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Makes you appreciate J R R Tolkien so much more~
review_detailed_main: What a dismal, boring, lackluster piece of trite self-indulgence! Jason, what were you thinking?? If you ever wondered why Burt Reynolds retired, just watch him as the good king...OMG! This film was miscast, lacked a coherent story, a shameless ripoff of LOR and so brutally misdirected that my son and I both fell asleep half way through. Not since Lindsey Lohan (I Know Who Killed My Career) have I seen such a hack job done on a fairly high budgeted film. No need of spilling the beans here with anything that could give away the plot...because there was no plot! If you like watching ice melt or get off on root canals, well, tuck in and enjoy. I can't believe this guy is directing another film, something is rotten in Germany and it ain't the cheese. I think Ed Wood may have new competition for worst director and 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' may have a rival for worst film ever...only problem, this will never be considered camp or fun like the other.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Might be Boll's best, which still isn't saying much.
review_detailed_main:
I confess I did not see the entire film, but most of it through to the end. A plot line equal to the task of loosely giving reason for a video game, it comes across even weaker as one for a movie. Another fantastic cast in a Uwe Boll film, which means the cast can only do so much to save another inevitable Boll failure.

So far as acting goes it struck my friends and I that Matthew Lillard's characterization was very well done, and could only have possibly been outdone by Andy Dick, which should tell you just how low a caliber character Lillard had to portray. Ray Liotta in most of his scenes looks like all he's missing is a white tiger and Sigfried in the background. Other notable actors did enough for their roles, nobody really stunk at them, but the weak direction left their impact rather flat.

We wasted a Netflix choice on this turkey, much less the better part of an hour and a half watching this movie. I highly recommend you don't follow suit.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Lets be objective.....

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A cinematic mess
review_detailed_main:
I wanted to like this movie, not in a wow kind of way, but in a hey at least it's entertaining kind of way. I failed. Watching it, I was growingly irritated, it was pathetic, acting was pathetic, the script was pathetic, and directing... It is said that the director can bring out the best from the actors and this movie is a living proof that the opposite stands true also. Ray Liota was unrecognizable as was Ron Pearlman and Leelee Sobieski, while Jason Stantham was quite fine, because he apparently understood the movie as being an action movie, the rest of the characters think they're in some Shakesperean play.

It appears the movie has an identity chrisis, it is very very far from being fluent, there are scenes that leave you in utter disbelief, or you have no idea why something happened, or you just saw something that is obviously impossible and then there are plenty of nice, likable, almost perfect scenes. Without thinking hard, it's tough to say why this movie is so bad, it's almost as if the director was cursed, unable to produce one single movie worth watching, like he was Ed Wood.

I couldn't recommend watching it...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Probably good for 3rd graders if you let them watch violent movies
review_detailed_main:
Okay, when I rented this movie, I did so not knowing that it was a Uwe Boll film. I didn't realize that until the end of the movie and seeing his name there, it all made sense.

This movie is really bad. If you watch it with a bunch of your friends while toking some homegrown wacky weed or having some beers... laughing at all the plot holes and stupid bits, then you might enjoy it (which is why I gave it 2 stars instead of 1).

I couldn't understand how Uwe Boll can continue to make movies and how he could recruit such an all-star cast for this movie. I think I understand now.

My first theory is that Uwe Boll is, in fact, proof of God. Because the only way I could imagine that he could still be making movies is if he had sold his soul to the Devil. However, I have since been educated that his films are backed by the German government. Corporate Welfare again rears its ugly head.

As to why such big names appear in his movies... I think I realize the answer to this too. The worst director of all time was Ed Wood. His movies are truly awful. They were so bad, that they gained a following of fans who would get drunk or stoned and pick apart how bad his movies were. Ed Wood gained further notoriety with the movie about him which featured Johnny Depp. I think Hollywood and Hollywood actors have come to the insane idea that Ed Wood was actually a misunderstood genius. That awful film will immortalize you just as much as a work of genius.

As I was watching "In the Name of the King", I paid attention to the acting of Ray Liotta, Burt Reynolds, etc. I think they were having fun in their roles, not taking them seriously at all. They knew the movie was a steaming pile of fecal matter and they were reveling in it.

Anyway, I cannot recommend this movie. Not for rental, not to illegally download for free. If your kids think that Power Rangers are cool... then I would think this movie would be adequate for them. This is definitely elementary school level.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: My "In The Name Of The King" Story
review_detailed_main: OK so it is a Wednesday, after a long day at work I go over to my parents for dinner and whatnot. After the meal my Dad asks if I want to watch this movie he rented that has Jason Statham in it (he is a huge fan ever since Lock, Stock). I say sure and he pops the DVD in. At first I was thinking well maybe the dialogue is supposed to be stilted and the dramatic raid on the town and I think, hmmm. About thirty minutes into the movie I just roll over on the couch and try to catch a nap. The movie kept playing and I couldn't fall asleep. After about fifteen minutes I think "god, this movie is awful, and I like awful movies!" Jokingly I say to my Dad, "I bet this is a Uwe Boll movie", he pays no attention and I look at the DVD cover and BAM! UWE FRAKING BOLL!!! I have never seen one of his films, but I did read the article in Wired a few years ago when he boxed some bloggers and the like. I couldn't believe it. He's is a director who's work I had never seen, rather avoided and I call it just from the sheer crap value of the picture. I am really sorry for the cast, I am betting the job for a paycheck...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not that bad, honestly, expected lot worse.
review_detailed_main: Uwe Boll is not the greatest director out there, enough said. But the movie, with all it's fantasy clichés, based on a game that is a shameless rip and as void from deep thoughts and meanings as the movie, really works. I've read some of the comments that this should not be compared to LOTR. May I ask why? Compared to LOTR this movie is jam packed with action and momentum, not the least a decent ending. Of course, not as well written and financed. The actors make a decent work in the genre, and really make the movie a better experience like say, Conan the Destroyer or Red Sonja. Not to mention that any movie where Jason Statham mutilates, beats up and utterly mangles his enemies is a huge plus. In conclusion i'd say it's a watchable entertainment package that stays loyal to the source material in good and bad, and it's not a bad sit through on a rainy day.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not even close to the story of the game. First film with Statham I didn't like...
review_detailed_main: With my missus we decided to buy this movie on bluray for 3 reasons: 1. We were playing the game. I finished both parts with extension packs and the Dugeon Siege is one of the best games I have ever played with great story, lots of action and great gfx. So we thought, game's great so maybe the film won't be bad... 2. We both love films with Jason Statham, always loaded with action. So why would this one be bad? 3. The price was great and we could get it for a tenner, which seemed to be great value. After watching the film, we said the same thing: 5th category cinematography. It didn't even resemble the original story of the game, apart from a couple of names. Krugs looked somewhat cheap... I can only say, if you don't have anything to do and can get it for free from a friend to watch, go on. You could always spend that time in a worse way (drinking, taking drugs etc.) If you are to pay for it, don't bother.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Uwe Boll is just misunderstood.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Burt Reynolds, Ray Liotta and Jason Statham in a knights movie? Count me in!
review_detailed_main:
What bizar, yet wonderful mix of terrific actors, who have all earned their merits with many classic action flicks. But there is a catch, there is always a catch...

The not so good: this knights movie has got all you would wish for in a fierce knights movie, tons of action, tons of cool poses, tons of glorious victories, tons a quests, the works, BUT it is a bit silly now and then, it just is. BUT it is the GOOD kind of silly, the one that you have to chuckle about, but still can enjoy.

I had to see all Jason Statham movies he has ever made and this movie is a one out, a kind of special one, because this is not the genre Jason Statham usually stars in, but he does a really (REALLY) good job. After having seen this I think it is a pity he hasnt starred in many other knights movies.

Definitely under rated, but beware it has got some silly moments, in between the many glorious macho fight scenes...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Awful acting
review_detailed_main: Ray Liotta and Matthew Lillard were absolutely terrible in this movie. I liked it up until those 2 started showing up more in the film.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: 2 hours 15 minutes I will never get back
review_detailed_main:
This is lord of the rings without the ring or the Lord for that matter.

I must admit I am baffled by the ratings. Half loved it(9or 10) half hated it. You can see by my rating my stance. The best part of the movie,the filming locations (BC Cananda)

I kept watching hoping that the movie would suddenly transform into something worthwhile. No such luck.I have noticed that many blame the director. The acting, poor storyline lack of substance and obvious ripoff of the ring make this an "I can't believe I watched this train wreck" experience. If it were a choice between watching this or volunteering to clean the filter at your local waste treatment plant, break out the rubber gloves.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: I liked the credits...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: I couldn't believe the low score...
review_detailed_main:
Especially with such a world class cast... until I watched it that is.

What a long piece of cheesy dross this film was.

A poor man's attempt at something akin to a medieval Lord of the Rings, which failed dismally.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Pretty bad on almost every level

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Miserable
review_detailed_main: I can't believe I was excited and purchased this title without first seeing who directed it. Same thing I did with Bloodrayne. I was about a 1/4 the way through when I thought wth is this? The special effects were awful, the acting was awful. With great actors no less! Only Uwe Boll could make this travesty. Horrible. I have to put ten lines of how much this sucked stir-fried rear end. I forced myself to watch the whole thing just to say I got something form my 20 bucks. So glad I did not go to the theater and watch this travesty. Should have been able to tell when it only lasted a week at the theatre. I think I saw a comment from someone who stated that this is better than LOTR! I would really like to meet this person. Die gustibus non est dispuntandum!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Confused but Happy
review_detailed_main:
I have to say, Overall this film was rather good for its Genre. I was concerned seeing Ray Liotta in the billing after seeing Jason Statham, Ron Perlman and Rhys Davies. The scenery was good, story was good, plots were almost key on. Other than some inept acting by Matthew Lillard it was pretty good.

I think they could have done much better with Liotta's character, first by casting someone else and second make him look less like a steam punk knock off and maybe more in genre.

My other complaint was the Krugs. This must have been the part of the budget that got the least input. I wont even get started.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: WHY this movie was awful.... Never again.
review_detailed_main:
I must be a glutton for punishment, but I decided to see this movie because with the trailer, it looked like it might have some potential. I have seen only two previous Uwe Bowe films and they were horrible.... I didn't have any high expectations, but I was just hoping this one would be different. Never again.

If I were to repeat what a previous reviewer mentioned ... how does he get such fantastic actors to do his movies? Don't these actors know that his movies are terrible? This definitely proves the fact that a good director is ESSENTIAL to a good movie. And that even great actors cannot shine when there is a horrible direction ...

I see a lot of posts where people just say that a movie was awful and that Bowe is an horrible director, but don't explain why....

I'm not a professional director or anything, but I just want to know if Bowe understands that shooting a scene requires perhaps ... a point, and like, maybe something to be accomplished. This can't be done when the each scene is about 30 seconds long. And just ENDS abruptly - like with a question that doesn't get answered. Slow things down a bit. And maybe EXPLAIN some things.

Even with the completely ridiculous dialogue in this movie, character development is very important in a plot - and when an audience is just taken on a whirlwind of different shots that don't linger long enough to fulfill any depth, then we are left with a very confusing and flat storyline. Seriously, is this a movie  or a music video??? There are more cuts in this movie than an international hair show. Obviously Bowe is very sloppy, lazy and doesn't spend the time to make any storyboards I'm sure if he did Greenpeace would be on his ass, cause that'd be a waste of a LOT of paper ....

Scenes are also cut in between each other quite frequently. At which it makes things utterly bewildering and a complete mess. Especially when you are inter-cutting a quiet dinner scene with a fight scene. Some really good directors can do it  but there has to be a connection between the scenes. Otherwise it is just idiotic. Remember the scene in ***Spoiler for LOTR: Return of the King*** when Pippin is singing to Denethor and they cut between his song and the battle. That is the sign of a good director. It was done with a reason and is incredibly powerful to the film. I know it ludicrous to compare the two, but just to make my point that there must be some purpose for inter-cutting scenes.

In addition, EVERYTHING is scored. Music adds a lot to film, but it is not necessary at every possible second in the movie. A good director is able to incorporate the score and with it, add emotion to a scene without the audience even noticing it. The score in this movie was so overdrawn that it was annoying... in fact it helped to incorporate an deadly element of cheesy melodrama....

It's quite obvious that Bowe is attempting to shadow the Lord of the Rings trilogy as he quite blatantly steals many components of the films. However, comparing him to Peter Jackson... well ...I can't even write both their names in the same sentence.

This movie had tremendous potential. But adding Bowe into it is like dropping some fish sauce into your Lemon Meringue Pie.

Don't waste money on this movie. I couldn't even finish it. It's terrible. And these are reasons why I believe so.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Brainless fun!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Surprise
review_detailed_main: I was pretty curious to see what a movie could come out of such a boring game. I was pleasantly surprised. It is not a very good movie, but good entertainment anyway.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Never mind the Boll-ocks
review_detailed_main:
Aw come on people, there's a lot worse than this out there. So it makes Krull look like Lord of the Rings, features Ray Liotta's most embarrassing performance (Liberace in a leather trenchcoat) and looks like it's been edited by a 5-year-old with ADHD, but there are at least two decent special effects amongst all the rubber masks and polystyrene boulders.

As my first Uwe Boll experience, I was disappointed by its near-competence. Sure, we're not dealing with a prodigious talent here, but Boll must be doing something right to assemble such a recognisable cast. Who else would think to produce an Arthurian pantomime with Hellboy, The Transporter, the Bandit, Gimli the dwarf, Shaggy from Scooby Doo, Hallam Foe's mum, one of the GoodFellas and a Terminator? A triumph of enthusiasm over ability, it has all the traditional fantasy ingredients: reluctant yet vengeful hero, damsel in distress, evil sorceror, good sorceror, world-weary king, cowardly duke, orc-like hordes, and even throws in a boomerang and a few babes in the wood for good measure.

Unfortunately, it's all dungeons without dragons and lords without rings. In the event, Boll overcooks and overcuts the whole caboodle to make it seem more exciting than it really is. But you have to admire him for playing it so straight.

One question: is Statham's character called Farmer because of what he does or because his brow looks like a ploughed field?

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Someone needs to be shot

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Dear o Dear
review_detailed_main: I've been putting this one off for some time, it keeps coming up on my recommendations and today was the day that I gave it a chance and I knew what was coming i was almost forced to watch it by amazon just to make it go away. It's like a bad lord of the rings rip off at best, lots of faces you would recognize and none of them fit there parts. It's painful to watch its like they were all in the pub one night and had a few to many drinks and came up with a film idea. At the time it seemed great but next day it never usually happens, well with this one it did. I'm still confused if you're a good actor why you would go through with it. Save yourself the pain I've been through, I've taken the bullet for you.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: If you love bad movies, this is a must see
review_detailed_main:
Yet another movie based on a video game by director Uwe Boll and this one isn't any better. This time, he was able to break the bank and get the biggest names he could find, even if the actors were completely wrong for the part. The casting for this movie makes no sense and I hope that the actors involved were well paid, because a movie like this can't be good for anyone's career.

The only redeeming quality, if there is one, is that the storyline isn't quite as much of a train wreck as the rest of the movie. It's still relatively lame and derivative, but has a couple of twists and surprises that keep your attention.

Really, the only reason you may want to watch this movie is to laugh at how bad it is.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: WOW! and not in a good way
review_detailed_main: I am watching this movie right now and I have to say I am not impressed. I have already figured out the plot and am not even paying attention any more. You would think with great, fun actors like Jason Statham, Leelee Sobieski, John Rhys-Davies, Ron Perlman and Matthew Lillard it would be a great fun movie. I looked up some info and this crap actually won a few awards! it won a Leo Award for Best Costume Design in a Feature Length Drama and Best Production Design in a Feature Length Drama. Which is not bad but there had to have been something better nominated! And why oh why was it nominated for Best Picture Editing in a Feature Length Drama. This is the worst edited movie ever! It made no sense! Go figure the Leo Awards are Canadian. In Germany it one an award for sound. Maybe its just the DVD I am watching but the music is so loud I came barley hear the dialoge Actually that may be may be a blessing! There is too much action and not enough story. The scenes that advance the storyline are so few and far between and chopped up I forget what's going on. The only reason I give it 2 stars is for the performances of Rhys-Davies, Perlman, Lillard and Sobieski. I find now that I enjoy watching them in anything and I mean anything. I feel as is I am watching a side story while the actaul plot is going on some where else.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: very good
review_detailed_main:
This is an excellent movie. I'm my book rates as one of the best fantasy movies ever. The cinematography is excellent! You truly have to appreciate artistic films to enjoys this!

Do not listen to the poor reviews. See this movie and you will probably not regret it. The scenery was excellent, I really enjoy a well choreographed movie with a artistic flow such as. The effects were great and the colors were as well.

My only beef was that some of the acting was a little lacking, also the lack of a consistent accents is an issue. The other thing is casting Bert Reynolds as a main actor in anything is a mistake especially a epic movie. The main villain is also a annoying actor that could have been played by someone else.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Are we talking about the same thing
review_detailed_main: Ok this isn't the best of the best, but this movie definitely deserves more than the comments and ratings given.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: I'd rather comment on it than watch it
review_detailed_main: It's on my t.v. right now...about 3 feet away. I can hear some dramatic music, I think someones dying. I'm not really interested enough to turn my head to the left check though. I'm on hour two of this 3 hour snoozefest. It looks like everything was shot in the same forest clearing and they just keep walking over the same ground over and over and pretending to travel. Also due to some really choppy editing characters are in completely different locales instantly. It's like they just keep teleporting from shot to shot. And the main character's name is "Farmer", it just sounds stupid. Ray Liotta has spent the last 90 minutes crouching in some mystical digital hurricane flashing his goofy 1980's sideburns dressed as a wizard. I didn't know that there were wizards from New Jersey. There's this one point where a monster lights himself on fire, climbs into a catapult and is launched into a tree trunk, gets up and hugs someone until they both immolate. That's actually a pretty good analogy for how I assume this movie was made. Worst of all Jason Statham does next to no karate in the film. What a waste!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Statham as badass as always
review_detailed_main:
Saw this at a recent screening. Story is very straight forward and the action delivers. Statham is good as the lead and Ray Liotta chews up scenery like crazy. Their final fight might not go down into the history of the best ones, but it's very original.

F/x are mediocre at times, but overall well made. The krugs looked a bit much like cheap orcs, but there you go. I guess the director didn't have the budget Peter Jackson had for LOTR. Favourite bit was the fight in the woods. Dungeon Siege succeeds in action and characters, plus variety of the very good looking sets. Just don't expect shakespearan dialogues.

I'm a major Jason Statham fan and while Chaos and Revolver pretty much sucked lately, this fantasy piece is him in best form again. It's all about the action and that's never a bad thing. Can't wait for Transporter 3 and Crank 3, but so long I was satisfied with Siege. Recommended for all the Statham geeks!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: In a word, cliché
review_detailed_main:
If you want your classic fantasy movie, this is it. It's got a simple farmer, bad guys who ruin his life, good guys beat bad guys. It's nothing special. The plot is rather predictable and is not new at all, even the "twists" are predictable. There is really only two good actors in the entire movie, the cgi is half decent but in the wide-shots it's easy to tell. Props are basic but still well done. It's obvious that the director was attempting to imitate any number of movies, Lord of the Rings especially, but in the same respect, it's hard not to imitate one movie or another these days.

I know I just said a bunch of... negative things about this movie, but I think it is still a half decent flick. If you watch it expecting a Lord of the Rings epic tale, you are going to be very disappointed - but then again there aren't many movies of that quality. Watch this movie and take it at face value. Don't try to look any deeper then what you see, because there really isn't anything more. Enjoy it for what it is. A nice little fantasy tale where the good prevails over evil.

Btw if you were curious, I would say that you could watch this as a family or let your kids watch it, assuming they are not to young of course. There is nothing that is all to scary and the fighting sequences are gore free, you see maybe three people impaled on swords and a few lit on fire and a few others shot with arrows. There is nothing graphic, it's more of a "ouch that would hurt" kind of thing. Some of it even bordering on the ridiculous.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A waste of 120mins of my life!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Uwe Boll bad
review_detailed_main:
In the kingdom of Ehb, Farmer (Jason Statham) lives peacefully with his wife Solana (Claire Forlani) and son Zeph. They are attacked by Krugs controlled by the magician Gallian (Ray Liotta). Zeph is killed and Solana is captured. With Norick (Ron Perlman) and Bastian, he sets off to rescue Solana. They meet Elora (Kristanna Loken) in the forest. King Konreid (Burt Reynolds) is undermined by his scheming nephew Duke Fallow (Matthew Lillard) who is in league with Gallian. Merick (John Rhys-Davies) is the King's right hand man but his daughter Muriella (Leelee Sobieski) had also been seeing Gallian in secret.

I probably gave this an extra point because I actually played the video game. Uwe Boll is a horrible director. This movie has enough money to work. The acting power is there on the screen. Statham is solid. However, this is an Uwe Boll movie. The story is boring. The dialog is horribly clunky. All the royal intrigue is unnecessary. It could have simply be Statham on a quest but that would be too good to be true. There's no way Boll would make anything good.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: It could have been worse, but it SHOULD have been better!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Drop down and give me 120 minutes of your Life!!!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: At lest for the time being, Bolls best film

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Surprisingly alot to like & enjoy in this Fantasy Adventure. Rather watch this than any Boring Brad Pitt or Tom Cult Cruise film anyday!!!!
review_detailed_main:
I've heard so much negativity & just plain hatred for this swords & sorcery adventure & it's director Uwe Boll but i Never listen to what everyone says because i usually like the films that all the "Critics" usually hate, so i wanted to see this "disaster" for myself!!!

In The Name Of The King: A Dungeon Siege Tale is a fun & fairly Epic action-packed fantasy adventure & i enjoyed it!!!

Now when i started watching this i thought how weird the casting choices were of Burt Reynolds & Ray Liotta & Mathew Lillard but as the film went on these bizarre choices actually all fell into place perfectly!!!

Hollywood Legend BURT REYNOLDS (R. I. P) actually suits being the old king & the manic MATHEW LILLARD was a great choice as the slimy, mental & cunning traitor as the Kings Nephew that is in cahoots with the evil magician played by a hammy RAY LIOTTA who is wanting to take over the kingdom & the land by gathering an army of monster warriors named "The Krug" (yes similar to Orcs) & those three strange casting choices actually worked out so well.

Now our hero of this epic tale is action legend JASON STATHAM as a peaceful family-man named "Farmer" who is a farmer & lives a quiet life with his beautiful wife (Claire Forlani) & their young son & STATHAM plays the type of scowling & hard fighter character he always plays & that's absolutely fine because we expect that & he delivers his kick-ass action in spades & we get one of my all time favourite actors ever as his best buddy "Norick" played by the great RON PERLMAN, this guy is in his comfort zone here in these period pieces of fantasy & action & has done many of these pictures such as "Season of the Witch" & "Outlander" & "Conan" & "In the Name of the Rose" & "The Scorpion King 3" among others, Ron Perlman is great as the kind-hearted but strong warrior Friend & gives another classy & likeable performance & a good character who gets plenty of great fight scenes.

Also another really good performance comes from the underrated LEELEE SOBIESKI (Road Kill) who is a warrior with powers & the daughter of the kings wizard friend played by JOHN RHYS-DAVIES, another very good performance by a guy who is really into his role & a great character. The cast is actually great.

Great points: This film will obviously be compared to "The Lord of the Rings Trilogy" & yes there's similarities as both are about the same type of stuff but i would pick "Dungeon Siege" over any "Lord of the rings" film as i enjoyed this B-movie fun fantasy way more & it's not as long & overdone as those films & i like this cast better, i mean Statham & Perlman together, Great.

The production levels are also actually Awesome most of the time except for some poor c.g.i times but it's mostly nice set pieces & real locations where all the action takes place.

The battle sequences are fantastic & the fighting is exciting, fast & kickass especially from Statham.

Mathew Lillard is over-the-top manic but it's suited to his annoying & horrible character that you so want to die.

Ron Perlman steals every scene he's in.

The "Krug" have a fun B-movie vibe to them & how they look, proper late-night B-movie fodder monsters.

The look & cinematography is often beautiful especially the scenes with the Forest warriors that come down from the vines in the trees.

Some Bad Bits: The music score tries to be too Epic & emotional & weighty & dramatic for a fun B-movie adventure flick.

Some of the c.g.i is cheap looking & some scenes look very artificial.

The film takes itself abit too seriously.

The opening scenes with Statham & his family is way over sweet & comes off ridiculously cheesy & feels like some Hallmark advert or something.

It is probably abit too long for a simple fun B-movie adventure film but it wasn't boring i gotta admit, it was entertaining.

I think I've given an honest review here & from not a Hater of the director or anything, i watched it for Statham & Perlman & it was a fun & action-packed fantasy adventure exactly like i expected it to be & i enjoyed it & would watch it again!!!

Pretty decent in my opinion.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not a good film, but a lot of fun.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Don't do it to yourself. I just lost 2 hours i ain't never getting back
review_detailed_main:
Well, if you were to read the cast it is a bit like a whose who of modern cinema. Put them all together with a shoddy director, terrible dialogue, terrible effects (Think i saw a guy wearing a straw hat in the fight halfway through) and a length of nearly 2hrs ten and you have what has to be one of the worst movies i have seen this year if not ever! I don't know what the budget is but i dare say it was spent on the cast and not the movie. I think you get my point so i will stop before i write something improper.

Now for some bullet points:

Bad Points: ( Here i Go!)

1) Director and direction. 2) Writer and Script adaptor for screen. 3) Costume - I mean, these bad soldier guys? Come on... 4) The CAST! I mean, did the not read the script and see what drivel they were getting themselves in for. 5) The Length of the movie. Schindlers list, Forrest Gump. No problems for spinning a movie out there. This? You are kidding.

Good Points:

1) Ummmmmmmmm

Hope you like my review!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not Bad
review_detailed_main: It's not the perfect movie, it has it's moments of just horrid dialogue and acting, but I mean c'mon this takes me back to the times when I was a kid watching the old eighties fantasy classics like Legend. It's just a fantasy movie, it's not trying to be LOTR and I have to say if this was something directed by someone other than Boll but it turned out the same, the reviews would be a lot better in that alternate universe. At least give Boll credit, this one is a step above his other crap like House of the Dead or the horrible Alone in the Dark, he's maturing as a director and this movie is that proof, it's not a big leap forward but hopefully the man can get it one day. I found the movie entertaining, it was a little more original than I thought, the whole time I watched this I didn't think once that I was watching a cheap rip off of LOTR I just felt like I was taken back to a simpler time when fantasy movies didn't need to be as artsy and Oscar worthy as LOTR.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Some things to appreciate

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Compared to other Uwe Boll travesties...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Cheesy and poor made
review_detailed_main: Despite of having a well known cast The acting, the fights, the plot, the dialogs are extremely stupid. their lineas and acting is poor, Jason does not know how to use a sword, the fights sequences and the costumes are a joke, But the worst of all is the cheap CGI and the Soundtrack/Music score that ls played in each scene.....

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: An Honest Review
review_detailed_main:
I saw this film when looking on IMDb to see the films that Jason Statham had been in. I am a fan as i like to be entertained. A lot of his films are over the top action, but i find that very entertaining. He will never win an Oscar, but most of his films are great fun. I wondered why I had not seen this advertise at the cinema, but within the first 10 minutes it was completely obvious that this film skipped the cinema and went straight to DVD and didn't waste any time going to 'free view with your package' on love film.

Where to start, this is clearly inspired by the Lord of The Rings films, which i loved. But the first problem with this film is the director Uwe Boll. I'm surprised this guy has been given the responsibility as director. This really is not his true talent. I feel sorry for anyone who was duped into being involved in the film thinking it would be an epic fantasy film that would end up a classic. The cast is good enough for an action film. Statham is Statham and it feels like you are watching The Transporter, but in the woods. He is convincing as a tough guy, but doesn't fit with this type of film. Burt Reynolds looked the part, but looked like he was filling a space in his schedule as he is so wooden and makes no effort. John Rhys-Davies is his usual over the top self. He almost provides some creditability, but almost becomes laughable.

Rather than compare this film to LOTR's i think it would be best to compare it to Xena Warrior Princess. It has that cheap family feel to it especially when they add in the pointless pieces of comic relief.

This film is a massive waste of time. I'm glad i watched it on my own on a weed night and didn't watch it with friends on a Saturday night as if it was my choice then no one would allow me to pick another film ever again. I would recommend that if you see this to rent/buy or watch online that you do not hesitate and just move to whatever is next.

Bad directing, bad script, bad acting, bad special effects, but reasonable fight scenes, but it was very noticeable that they only had about 100 extras just doubling up. When they have the army lined up they are quick to move to another angle before they run out of people to fill the shot. The creatures are really poorly designed and are not scary or creepy what so ever.

If you are a fan of Xena then you still may be disappointed in this 156 minute movie. Shocking film.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Abomination to all fantasy fans
review_detailed_main: Monster costumes so rubbery the swords bounced on impact, characters so clichéd Disney are suing, and a script so badly written even autocorrect gave up. I did too. So should you. The director obviously did.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Anyone who gives this heap of donkey poop above a 3 needs to look into a mirror, slap themselves in the face and re evaluate their lives
review_detailed_main: Even if you're a fan of the genre with movies like warcraft, season of the witch, and seventh son...I would give this movie a VERY hard pass it was so bad. At least the above mentioned genre movies had very good production value. This movie looks like it was shot for 50 dollars and the only budgeting was to pay its awesome, but bloated cast. I watched this being a big statham fan. But good loooooord this was truly awful.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Nice try!
review_detailed_main: The only reason why I watched this movie is because my friend appeared briefly as an extra. Thankfully he made his appearance 20 minutes into it. After that I lost interest. I just want to know how they cast Leelee Sobieski? She must have been strapped for cash if she agreed to do this. Burt Reynolds added a touch of comic relief, and Ray Liotta should stick to "Wise Guy" roles. Who decided to dress him as an Elvis Presley impersonator. Anyways... I have seen worse movies. If you have a couple of hours to waste then give it a go, just watch it alone! By the way, my friend is the guy with a beard who is standing next to Jason Statham in the village when Burt Reynolds is looking for soldiers to join his army. Nice job Pete!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not good, but you may watch it

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Cinematic Perfection
review_detailed_main: I saw this movie when it came out in theaters with my husband, brothers, and mom. The theater was absolutely silent, except for us. This movie made us laugh so hard. It is ridiculous and if you decide to watch this, do it with a sense of humor. It's bad but hilariously so. You'll get hippie tree strippers, scenes taken from Lord of the Rings, Orcs that light each other on fire and then launch them during battles. Get some popcorn, sit back and stop taking things too seriously.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Hardcore fantasy fans only. I enjoyed watching Farmer with his 'my way or the highway' approach battle through the film. But many won't.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: You know... for kids...
review_detailed_main: This movie is not that bad if you consider there's quite a few well known faces in it and the movie is a fairy-tale. Granted, I had to repeat the latter to myself otherwise I wouldn't be able to survive it, but then again, at least there were no kid heroes who fight adults. The movie is not exceptional in anything, but its not also exceptionally bad in any part. It's pretty straightforward, bad guys are bad, good guys are good, there's love in it, there's magic in it, there are wars with ugly ogres in it (or whatever they are), what else you want from a fairytale for kids ? I would recommend it when you wanna keep your youngsters occupied for two hours and they're under 13.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: This movie filled the objective of providing entertainment
review_detailed_main: Much of what comes out of Hollywood these days is epic nonsense and this movie has also inherited from that trait however I was amazed at the number of user comments that horrifically bashed this film like a class of kids and wannabe critics. I agree there are many flaws that someone on a mission to criticize could sink their teeth into so if it is your intent to go to this movie for that purpose then I ask on behalf of the audience to keep your comments to yourself. It is apparent that the actors and crew on this film really did work hard and try to deliver a product of entertainment. The film was fine for TV but I would have expected more for one in the theater. The only character that was really bad was Duke Fallow who was extremely annoying but didn't ruin the whole film. I agree that it is not a great film but no where near as bad as many commenters have depicted it to be although I suspect it would have been that bad if not for the great cast. Overall I was entertained and if you're not a critic wannabe then go ahead and see it.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Absolutely one of the worst movies I've ever seen
review_detailed_main: I mean are we not supposed to notice that most of these guys have no English accent? The dialogue was horrible. Completely ripped off Gladiator and GOT. A MUST NOT SEE! How do some of the world's best actors agree to such a horrible script?

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: No it is not "cheesy fun"
review_detailed_main:
No it really isn't it's crap.!

Rubbish acting horrible plot dialogue and direction. All shot horribly.

Seriously. It is so bad. Jason Statham looks embarrassed. Ron Perlman is just laughable. They are just running around in dreadful costumes like some kid of dreadful middle England thing fighting some pig faced soldiers and fighting and fighting and more fighting which the women cook and feed the children. It's so horrible, cheesy fun is not this. This was meant to be serious. Oh my word!

Avoid like the plague.

How on earth do they get away with making this bilge I will never know someone has their hand in a deep pocket somewhere.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Don't hate the movie, hate the Director...
review_detailed_main:
This movie had so much potential...

It had a great cast and because I like many of them I rate it as high as a 4. Though even the cast's acting was hurt by the director. This is some of their worst work and I entirely blame Boll.

Camera angles, transitions, beginning, end... you name it Boll did it bad. The movie just throws you in the middle... and that's all it really is a middle with a climax at the end that just... well... It's and ending that doesn't seem to end much...

The Director either has no creativity or is just talentless. His idea of portraying death was pitiful...

The sound track was right... it fit the crappy directing!!! I want to say so much more that was bad but it would be a waste of effort and keystrokes...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Don't watch it.
review_detailed_main:
Where do I start? I watched this film on netflix after it being out for 7 years and I have to say, this is the first time I've ever heard of Uwe Boll. Making movies adapted from video games is a good idea but everyone knows that a game or film made by the counterpart always, and I repeat, always bad. They ruin the franchise. When the film started, I thought it was okay until it got to the first battle scene in Stonebridge, #1 I don't see a bridge and #2 there was only a house or 2 that was actually in stone. How awful. The bit where Statham's character slashes and 'kills' a krug, wheres the blood? How was he able to lift that ugly goblin thing? We know these characters have blood as we see Solana with some on her head, Gallain when stopping a sword smash onto his head, Duke stabs some general and wow, there's blood on the dagger but no, slashing in that universe means no blood for either the krug or the humans. Another question that popped up in my head, why where the krugs taking the humans, to be slaves? all i ever saw was them tied in chains sitting on the floor.

'In The Name Of The King'. Okay what does that mean? 90% of the film was about Statham's character, we only learnt about him being the king right before his battle with Gallain.

it's truly awful, I watched it because I thought it was interesting, hence the title name but nope, I will never again watch a movie by this awful director, WHY IS HE STILL DIRECTING?????????????????????????????????

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Beware anyone who tells you what to do, think... or watch.
review_detailed_main: I've seen better and worse. It's not LOTR but it's not Orcs either. Four of the cast are among my faves (not Jason (except Snatch)). I wouldn't crawl half a mile over broken glass to pay to see it, but I've watched it twice (once sober), and I think it's ok. Shame about the bodices but that's the film industry for you.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Yes, it's really not that great
review_detailed_main: The acting is really bad. The beasts are human in very stupid costumes. No CGI, no great special effects. Just a bad script.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: this movie was awesome

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Oh, come on, it wasn't THAT bad!
review_detailed_main:
Being an Uwe Boll movie it was hardly a surprise it would be bad. The cast might have cast some hope at first glance, but let's face it: Jason Statham fights well and has a good voice, that's about it; John Rhys-Davies, Ron Perlman and Burt Reynolds are too old to get any decent roles anyway; Ray Liotta has become incapable of playing anything else than a psychotic bad guy, while beauties Claire Forlani and Kristanna Loken have dropped from the public view for quite a while. Leelee Sobieski was a complete surprise, though. She could and should have done better.

So what did you expect? The plot was predictable, the dialogues painful and the special effects directly proportional to the movie's budget. Lord of the Rings this could not have been.

This being said, the rest of the film was quite enjoyable. Good versus evil, ridiculously short cut dialogue or story scenes, just as ludicrous long fight scenes, everybody is the son, daughter or some distant relative of one's neighbour, love, revenge... fun fun fun.

Bottom line: ridiculous but possibly enjoyable film. It was bad, but not so bad as the IMDb rank would say. Ray Liotta did a decent villain, given the shallowness of the script, while Kristanna Loken finally returned to the short haired, short skirted leather wearing sexy self.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Exceptional
review_detailed_main:
Wow, this was something. From the action sequences to the dialogue, this film will make you laugh. Character motivations often seem confused, the krugs look like fat guys coated in dried mud, many of the special effects look ridiculous, and the overall cinematography makes it feel like the director had no idea what they were doing*. So bad it's good, put it on with a group of friends and alcohol, and roast it!

Having seen some of the director's other work, this does seem to be the case.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Bad mix
review_detailed_main: This movie needs a new ediing, new music, new pace, basically a new director

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: One of the Worst!
review_detailed_main: This may be the worst movie I've seen in several years, so I felt obligated to join in and inform people not to waste ANY time on it. I don't remember why my buddy and I decided to watch this in the first place. I'll admit the stupidity of it all actually made us laugh pretty hard a few times, but that's the only redeeming aspect you can find to this movie. After this one, I've officially concluded that Jason Statham just accepts any movie script you throw at him, cause he should have seen how bad this would be from the start. Uwe Boll is obviously well known for directing some of the worst movies around, which had I known that in the first case I would never have watched it. All the acting in the movie is HORRIBLE, which is surprising since some of the actors have actually been in tons of other movies and done a decent job. Ray Liota's character is dumb. Jason Statham's character name being 'Farmer', doesn't help anything since his acting is very sub par in this as well. Matthew Lillard become my least favorite actor for at least a year after his devastating performance in this movie as Duke Fallow. To go along with the bad acting, this movie couldn't have possibly took much to make since the bad guys known as the "Grug" I believe look like the initial Power Rangers villains from the early nineties. All in all this is an outrageously bad movie that I should not have the misfortune to see for sale on store shelves. Enjoy!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: How is it possible to make such bad movie with so much great actors?
review_detailed_main:
Seriously how is it possible in 2007 (6 years after The Fellowship of the Ring) to make a movie this bad? And with so many good actors.

It is like seeing a train wreck from the very begin, you can't take your eyes from it but you also know it will keeping to get even worst.

Not the worst time wasted I ever did but probably comes very close. The only positive thing is that I have learned to never again see anything from this director.

If you didn't see it please save yourself and skip it.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not bad enough to be good
review_detailed_main:
Maybe I watch too many bad movies, but this really didn't live up to its terrible reputation... much to my disappointment.

Dungeon Siege is a long, boring, by-the-numbers fantasy "epic" with a few good moments and a lot of poor choices. This makes it a bad movie, but not a BAD movie on the scale of Boll's previous disasters (Bloodrayne, Alone in the Dark) and therefore much less entertaining. Maybe he's learning?

My point is: for people seeking another "so bad it's good" classic, I recommend you look elsewhere.

The problem with Dungeon Siege is that the story and the acting are both fine(ish); it's the directing and editing that kill the movie. This makes it more irritating than funny, and aside from a few spots of ludicrous dialog (I dare you to make sense of Reynold's final speech!) it's more hum-drum than fun.

Others have enumerated the films worst points already (Liotta!), so I won't repeat them. However I have to say: the hate for Matthew Lillard confuses me. He single-handedly made all of his scenes watchable. If every actor had been as entertaining as he was, this would have been a much, much better movie.

Long story short: not bad enough to be funny, not good enough to be good, so don't bother.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Fantasy claptrap from Uwe Boll.
review_detailed_main:
In The Name Of The King stars Jason Statham as farmer Farmer (no, that is not a typing mistake), who is drawn into a battle between good and evil that sees him finally claiming his birthright: the Kingdom of Ehb.

Jason Statham (The Transporter, The Expendables), Leelee Sobieski (Eyes Wide Shut, Deep Impact), John Rhys-Davies (Raider Of The Lost Ark, The Lord Of The Rings), Ron Perlman (Hellboy), Claire Forlani (Meet Joe Black), Kristanna Loken (Terminator 3), Matthew Lillard (Scream, Scooby Doo), Ray Liotta (Goodfellas), and Burt Reynolds (Deliverance, Smokey And The Bandit): an all-star cast in an almost all-crap movie.

I say 'almost' because, despite his many failings—shockingly bad storytelling and an inability to command a decent performance from any of his stars—much-derided director Uwe Boll actually manages to pull off several surprisingly impressive battle scenes and delivers quite a few aesthetically pleasing, CGI-enhanced, sweeping panoramas in the style of Peter Jackson, all of which make this nonsense just about bearable if in a forgiving mood.

3.5 out of 10, rounded up to 4 for gratuitous ninja action. Ninjas can make anything seem a little bit better.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not great but OK entertainment
review_detailed_main: Don't take out the terrible direction on the poor actors. You've seen how good they can all be. Uwe Boll has directed a LOT of B grade films, rarely cracking 4 on IMDB. Wonder he can gather $60M to gross $15M globally? The talent here has a pedigree. Statham, Reynolds, Liotta, Perlman, Folani, Rhys-Davies & Sobieski are some of my favourites, buy I never get to see them together. Give him that anyway. You can chill, without thinking too much and just enjoy the show for what it does have. Plenty of action, great actors doing their best with poor direction, and a time honoured plot of good vs. Evil.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not as bad as assumed

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Stop whining and watch the movie! It's a great flick.
review_detailed_main: It's a great movie, i don't understand what everybody is whining about. True that it's not "Lord of the Rings", but if comparing to many other fantasy movies it's a treasure. It's has great action delivered by Jason, a regular fairytale storyline and the humor is not bad at all too. The movie has many great famous actors in it and they do a very good job. Yes the bad guys in the movie may seem nuts. Yes, the movie may seem long, but nothing is perfect. and instead of looking for the bad spots think about the concept behind. and if the movie is too long for you watch it with a break. I will say it again- Stop whining and Watch the Movie, it's GOOD!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: What's the beef?
review_detailed_main: I saw this on TV tonight and don't feel it was a waste of time. Reading the reviews on here afterward was a waste. If a movie holds your attention it has achieved something. This Uwe Boll seems to take a pounding but this was no cheap flick. People need to see a film as they did when they were kids; to be entertained. We even enjoyed the films that we made fun of while watching. My son of 15 would have enjoyed this but since he wasn't here I watched it for him. Burt Reynolds: Glad to see him working. The other name actors seemed to be enjoying themselves. Some movies you can watch more than once. I'm not saying this is one of them.
