movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: We had it all and lost it...
review_detailed_main:
I want to go study filmmaking! This movie makes me think.. and that's usually not my purpose when I watch. Certainly not a SF-movie... Good actors, good landscapes, good effort, good story (if you can tell a story), beautiful men, nice tities, a girl I would fight for, and who doesn't want to kill orc's... PLEASE let me escape in this movie!

Still... it is bad. Makes me think and wants me to go to school so that someone explains to me everything that went wrong. Maybe the makers can come to.

Somethings I know, and this one because I got like seasick: don't move the camera to much! No alcohol for the cameramen (or just a little if they tremble after this new rule) 2. Don't put a horse on a roof, not even for carnaval.

3. You should not fear the "cut" by the makers more than the swinging swords. A "cut" is not to feel as a knife through your storyfollowing brain.

I feel sad, what a waste of good things. Maybe they should give all the footage to me or students and make a competition: fix this! Or at least make it watchable.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: 29 years is a bit much!
review_detailed_main: There's nearly a 30 year difference between Ray Liotta and Leelee Sobieski. Am I the only one totally grossed out by that? Other than that it's pretty terrible all around, especially given the star-studded cast. Go watch The Princess Bride (again) it will make you much happier.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Amazing cast...like the epitome of the avengers!
review_detailed_main: Statham fan big time. Liotta! Is the crap! Then I had to get drunk af. Just to watch some of the worst acting...worst sword fighting...worst battles since Harry Potter ride his first broom...shockingly surprised at how bad the story line rides the bad action...only saving grace is my love of Stephen King....pretty sure I'm watching a bad recreation of the Watchtower..

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: You don't have to watch this movie
review_detailed_main: First of all you should not watch this movie only and only to see Jason Statham because Jason Statham can't carry this movie on his back and the funny thing is That I watched this movie after Batman Dark Knight which is a movie that I recommend you watch . Let's talk about this movie first of all it has some scenes that you can connect with the characters and you get emotional and there is Jason Statham who despite the movie was bad he gave his best self in this movie but anything else in this movie is just BAD and after watching this movie I laughed exactly like joker because I couldn't find any reason to put it more than 3 stars well the 3rd star is thanks to Statham . I firmly believe that this movie DOES NOT WORTH YOUR TIME thanks for reading.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: I was surprised
review_detailed_main:
OK, so this isn't Lord of the Rings, as everyone seems to compare it to. Get past that folks. Nothing will compare to that trilogy for YEARS to come. However, In the Name of the King was NOT a horrible film as everyone makes it out. Now, that doesn't mean it is a "Great" film, either. I would definitely say it was an "Okay" film.

I can't stand Uwe Bowle. He is a joke when it comes to movies based on Games. However, a game like Dungeon Siege is perfect for him. He has a basic premise, and a very open plot to work with. You can't screw that up. Honestly, he didn't. This movie is FAR better than some of the drudge that Sci Fi channel has put out over the recent years. This is also leaps ahead in quality to previous Bowle film's.

Yes, the acting was not gripping, and the action was a little "eh", but again, it was better than some low budget fantasy movies.

Look at it this way, there was a solid beginning, a meaty middle, and an actual finish to this film. Bowle referenced towns and locales from the game from time to time, he maintained a basic drive and purpose for the enemies, and kept the heroes on track with their purpose. This movie did indeed hit on Fantasy Movie cliché's, but they managed to work well enough.

Now, I know some will say a "5" is to gratuitous, but if this was NOT a Bowle film, would people actually have rated it higher? I am sure they would. Again, I am NOT a Bowle Fan. Alone in the Dark was not up to par, Blood Rayne was WAY to far from the plot of the game, and House of the Dead was dead in the water. In the Name of the King was enjoyable for the most part. Get over it. Just be glad he will never do Metal Gear Solid!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Bad...
review_detailed_main:
"In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale" is an Action - Fantasy medieval movie in which we watch a farmer, who embarks on a mission to rescue his kidnapped wife and avenge the death of his son, all while facing off against an evil sorcerer and his army.

I have to admit that I didn't expect this movie to be that bad. The direction which was made by Uwe Boll wasn't something special or memorable and his attempt to deliver an epic tale ended up as a tedious, incoherent mess. The movie's weak script, poor interpretations, and laughable special effects didn't help at all. Despite its high-profile cast, which includes Ray Liotta who played as Gallian, Burt Reynolds who played as King Konreid, and Leelee Sobieski who played as Muriella, their interpretations were uninspired. Jason Statham didn't reach his potential and I believe he didn't fit for the role. Finally, I have to say that "In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale" is a very poor movie and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A Rambling Piece of Cheese

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Am I the only person who genuinely loves this film?

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Good cast but...
review_detailed_main: Jason Statham just doesn't fit in movies like this one...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Boring

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Worst film
review_detailed_main: I believe this is the worst film I have ever seen with Jason Statham in. Acting by all was terrible, graphics terrible. I would not recommend this to anyone, unless you are finding it hard to go to sleep, this will definitely help.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Laughable! How did they get these stars to sign on for this?!
review_detailed_main:
Saw this movie on Netflix...wish I hadn't. I figured "How bad could it be?" I mean, Jason Statham, right? OK, so he's portraying a farmer / warrior type guy back in the middle ages...but still. I've seen him in enough movies to know what to expect from him. And basically, he played the same character he always plays - only this time in a different time period.

Aside from Statham's performance (which wasn't great), this movie was terrible! The main characters were all laughable! As soon as I saw Ray Liotta's character, I knew things were gonna be bad. By the time Burt Reynolds appears, I'd had enough.

Don't waste your time.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: In The Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale (2008) - Movie Review

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Almost a Bad Parody, But Not Quite
review_detailed_main: Terrible lines, bad filming, predictable, corney and extra cheesy. The only nice thing about this movie is seeing some familiar actors, but with what they were given to act with, it puts them to shame and makes their parts laughable.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Perfect example of a bad movie
review_detailed_main: I actually bought this movie recently because I just had to own this, I remember seeming this in theaters and just being amazing at how awkward and just how everything was not working. I think this film should be studied by film students because it's the only film I know that's a perfectly example of bad everything. Some movies have a bad story, others bad acting, but this is bad cinematography, bad story, bad lines, bad delivery of the lines, bad special effects, bad editing, bad costumes, bad literally everything. It's amazing. You know how Lord of the Rings makes Fantasy cool, this makes it nerdy again, in the worst way.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Fun!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: The poor man's version of "The Lord of the Rings"...
review_detailed_main: Awful. Not even Jason Statham could save this utter abomination set to celluloid. The fight scenes were not even fun one bit in the least, if anything, they were boring. The dialogue was also unbearably atrocious. The special effects were abysmal, too! I could not wait for it to be over with. I want 2 hours and 7 minutes of my life back. If you want a grand epic adventure film, watch Peter Jackson's live-action adaptation of J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings" trilogy, but whatever you do, AVOID "In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale" like the plague. Put simply, this movie was a complete train wreck and like most of Uwe Boll's other films, it makes anything by Ed Wood look Oscar-worthy.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Find another Statham movie!
review_detailed_main:
I like fantasy and somewhat spiritual movies. In that sense this movie could have been good. The story was okay too, but the execution is as the overall rating suggests: crap.

First there is the almost constant overwhelmingly loud music, and bad choice of music at that. Very 70s but those days have gone and when it comes to this aspect, a good thing!

In itself they did have a strong cast, Jason Statham, Ron Perlman, Ray Liotta, but the way this movie is construed doesn't do them any justice. I love watching Jason do his martial arts, I'm a big Jason & martial arts fan. But even I got fed up with the badly shot and directed scenes. Not even a bloke like Jason can salvage the level of crap.

Why the heck they chose to take this amateur-style route is beyond me. They could've pulled it off, I mean, look at LoTR and The Hobbit, and the story itself is viable. This genre can be insanely popular, but then it has to be done right.

All in all... even if you're a Jason Statham and martial arts fan like me, forego this one. It really isn't worth it.

Oh, and they should NOT have cast Ray Liotta. Not for that role. BAD choice!

I'm not usually one for harsh rating, but this one deserves it.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: This felt like a bad episode of Xena. This should not have been this bad with the storyline and cast, but once again Boll creates a debacle.
review_detailed_main:
In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale (2007) is a movie I recently received as a gift and sat down and watched with my wife. The storyline follows a king's son who joins powers with an evil sorcerer to bring back evil and take over the king's land. When a farmer's family is adversely impacted by the evil beings he decides to take up with some some of the other locals and go toe-to-toe with the evil sorcerer and the king's son.

This movie is directed by Uwe Boll (BloodRayne) and stars Jason Statham (Crank), Ray Liotta (Goodfellas), Ron Pearlman (Hellboy), Burt Reynolds (Gator), Leelee Sobieski (Joy Ride), John Rhys-Davies (Lord of the Rings), Matthew Lillard (Scream), Kristanna Loken (Terminator 3) and Brian White (Stomp the Yard).

The storyline and cast for this had tremendous potential. Unfortunately the execution was absolutely awful as were the special effects. The magic scenes by Liotta were painful to watch. I'm not sure Liotta was a good selection as the villain. The action scenes were uneven. Some fight scenes with Statham were good, some that needed CGI (like the rope scene) were as painful to0 watch as Liotta's magic. The creatures in the forest were awful and wasn't as menacing as the orcs in Lord of the Rings. The movie run time was also way too long. The film obviously tried to ride the Lord of the Rings coat tail...it fell way short.

Overall this felt like a bad episode of Xena. This should not have been this bad with the storyline and cast, but once again Boll creates a debacle. I would score this a 2/10 and recommend skipping it.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: In the name of the king, we deserved to watch it...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Why can't I give it a rating of 0?!?
review_detailed_main: If you have the desire to watch your best friends suffer in a most horrific and distasteful manner, but have been searching for the proper way to carry out this punishment, your search has finally ended. In what I can only describe as your local meth head's Return of the King I present to you Uwe Boll's Magnum Opus. Where do I begin in describing the beauty, the brilliance, nay the piece de resistance that is Uwe Boll's In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale. Featuring mostly wooden performances, laughable dialogue, and shoddy production values, In the Name of the King fulfills all expectations of a Uwe Boll film. You will not be disappointed as you live the adventure through the eyes of Farmer, a lowly farmer who has the misfortune of living next door to Hellboy, I mean, Mugatu's fugly older brotherI mean Ron Perlman. Watch as Farmer (Jason Statham), attempts to avenge the murder of his child and try to save his beloved wife from the acting of Ray Liotta (I mean honestly, that is the real reason he is the villain in this movie). Experience the pain as Farmer must witness Uwe Boll blackmail Gimli and Burt Reynolds into being featured in this film (they really didn't want those nude pics leaked), much like Julie Andrews in The Princess Diaries 2. Prepare for a roller coaster of emotions as you try to contain disbelief from the get go, anger as you realize that you are still watching this film, and finally joy as you revel in the utter bliss signaling the credits. I give it two thumbs somewhere.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Uwe Boll strikes again.
review_detailed_main:
Whoo hoo. Another craptastic film by Uwe Boll. I really don't know how he does it and gets the funding to keep making these terrible films. The ridiculous music and sound effects and cheesy acting make possibly decent story line and turns it to crap. Even the A list actors cant make a Uwe Boll film good.

Honestly this story has so much potential to actually be a good movie, there's obviously a good funding for this particular film, the graphics have been pretty damn good. The stunts have been a feat and a half to watch. I particularly enjoyed the "amazon" women in the forest. It was good to see Leelee in acting again, even if it was in a Uwe Boll film. >.>

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Sad
review_detailed_main: So...I have been able to sit through some very bad movies. This is not the worst and it is entertaining in a mediocre way if you're hungry for a medieval fantasy flick. Sadly, the wonderful array of actors is wasted on this movie.It's fun to see people like Ron Perlman and John Rhys-Davies, but here they are mixed in with Burt Reynolds and Ray Liotta, both fine actors but not in this genre. Actually, nobody is fine in the movie. The characters are not well developed, especially the women of the movie. The dialog is just plain silly and the special effects do not flow smoothly. I wanted to root for Farmer but the book I was reading was more interesting. Still, the movie was watchable, if uneven.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: I enjoyed watching "In the name of the king"!!!
review_detailed_main: Despite all the bad critique "In the name of the king" received, I decided to rent it because I love the "adventure/action/fantasy" genre. I actually enjoyed watching it. Good acting! Loved Jason Statham in the lead role. He plays a farmer who tries to rescue his wife who was kidnapped by monsters who are controlled by a sorcerer. As always in fantasy movies it is "good versus evil", with a love story, magic, fighting scenes, and beautiful scenery included. All the leading roles are played by well known actors like Burt Reynolds, John Rhys-Davies, Claire Forlani and LeeLee Sobieski. Brian J White was drop dead gorgeous as commander Tarish. The only thing i didn't like about the movie was the music. It's OK to use "dramatic violin music" to set the mood in some scenes, but there was basically violin music throughout the whole film . If you enjoy the fantasy genre - then don't pay attention to the negative comments people give about Uwes work- go and rent it! It is worth the money!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: One of those "Meh" movies.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: It was so bad I wanted to cry
review_detailed_main:
I just lost 2 hours of my life watching this movie that I can never get back. I love medieval time movies. So we watched this one. About 10 minutes into it we were thinking uh oh, this is gonna suck. 30 minutes later we were contemplating fast forwarding through it to see if it ended up getting better. But were afraid we would miss some vital element in the movie and then it would be even worse than if we could just watch it straight through. It even had an all star cast! Actors that do very well & I enjoy watching. The dialog was painful to listen to as the actors did what that could with an awful script. The special effects were, well there really weren't any. Unless you consider the stuff on the original Star Trek special effects.

Basically it was Robin Hood Men in Tights meets Lord of the Rings meets Braveheart...then take away money for scenery & costumes & add horrible dialogues and you've got it!

This producer guy, Uwe Boll, was crazy enough to make a part 2 & a part 3 of this movie also but the 2nd & 3rd time around he try's to throw in some time travel!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Worse than Bloodrayne
review_detailed_main: However, that's like saying stepping in a pile of dog turds is worse than getting pooped on by a flock of seagulls... Who gives Uwe money to keep making films!?! Why do I watch them? Regardless, I couldn't finish it so it gets a 2. Having said that, not everything was terrible -- eg, the sets were fine -- so, it's not a 1.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Power Ranger Quality
review_detailed_main:
From the beggining something was off. Can't be the acting, they're too good. The script, the filter on the camera? Surely part of the answer.

But then it was just obvious that the direction was amateurish at best. When I first saw the orchish-like beasts moving like the aliens in Power Rangers that was the final sign it wouldn't be getting better.

Statam gets rid of the 5 orcs then runs to aid his friend. "What took you so long?" Really... that's the best line they could think of? Might as well put in "I'll be back" somewhere in there.

It got worst when they horsebacked to the village to a full scale battle. Badly choreographed battles, slow and telegraphed moves while enemy just waiting there to get killed, no blood, to swords or spears piercing through. Only slashing just like a low budget B movie. And again with the yellow filter.

Comes Ray Liotta's character to finish me: dressed and groomed like a pimp from the dark ages. His telepathic control from a distance while in a cylindre of smoke was really, really kitch at best. Why does he always have the same hair cut in all movies? He looked like Henry Hill from Goodfellas in a bathrobe.

The whole 24 min had a Power Ranger, original Star Trek, Excalibur feel to it.

Now, Power Rangers was low budget and they played with it with full knowledge. Star Trek was in the 70's-80's and a pionneer in its kind and Excalibur was a great movie.... in 1981.

40 years later, a star studded cast and I can't watch more than 24min eventhough I was expexting a "turn off you head" type of movie.

Quite pathetic.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A tedious, dull and cheap-looking knockoff of Lord of the Rings
review_detailed_main:
The fantasy genre certainly has its ups and downs. On the one hand, we've got epic, multi-award winning sagas like the "Lord of the Rings". In the other we've also got a good amount of laughably bad, shoddily made ones like "Dungeons & Dragons". Earning itself a likely permanent spot among the worst of is "In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale". It's a film that is not only poorly acted, written and made, but it's also tedious and excruciating to watch. The story follows a man creatively named Farmer (Jason Statham) whose son is killed by an army of orcs I mean Krugs. His wife is captured so off he goes to rescue her from the creatures and their foul overlord, the evil wizard Gallian (Ray Liotta?! Say it isn't so!). He gets some assistance from an old friend Norrick (Ron Perlman? Seriously?). We learn that Gallian is planning on raising an army to overthrow the king of the land (Burt Reynolds) with the help of the king's sniveling, slimy nephew, Duke Fallow (Matthew Lillard). Time for some sword battles, epic battles in the rain, wizardry, some Ringwraith knock-offs and some silly political backstabbing. Take it away Uwe Boll! I'm not going to say that this movie rips off the Lord of the Rings, but there are some elements that are surprisingly similar. We've got the dueling wizards, with John Rhys-Davies (who played Gimli in the Peter Jackson films) playing the good counterpart to Gallian, we've got the armies of orcs, the elf-like forest creatures, the shadowy horse riders that Gallian uses to command his armies and a couple of scenes here and there. I'm not saying that this is a terrible movie because of these though, I'm saying the movie's so bad even if it was the first fantasy film you ever saw it you would have a hard time sitting through it.

First of all, what kind of protagonist are we given? A guy named "Farmer". Apparently he calls himself that because he believes that a man is whatever he does. Does that mean that if he becomes the mayor of the town he'll change his name to "Mayor Mayor"? Jason Statham has had his share of bad movies but he's never been more wooden or less charismatic than here. Even when he's throwing boomerangs or inexplicably doing karate kicks, you'll wish the film was following someone else. Singling out Statham isn't quite fair though because pretty much everyone here comes off as an amateur. Matthew Lillard plays his character way over the top. It's a wonder the guy hasn't been thrown in a dungeon under suspicion of every single unsolved murder in the city. Ray Liotta looks absolutely bored in every scene he's in, but might just be trying to turn invisible so no one notices him. Overall, everyone is trying to get through the cringe-worthy dialog as best they can but few escape unharmed. I'd give some examples, but the film's lack of subtitles (an inexcusable sin considering this DVD was released in 2008) makes it hard to quote.

I was actually taken aback by how shoddy the action sequences were. Every scene where farmer goes around kicking looks very staged and are not the least bit exciting. Late into the film they explain why our titular character is able to kick so much ass, but until then these Krugs come off as real chumps. A significant amount of them fall down after being kicked in the chest and then never get up and come on, they can't take down an old guy armed with a pickax? Story-wise, it comes off as pretty laughable often. I know it's for dramatic effect, but I'd like to imagine that the reason there happened to be a wedding going on when the Krugs first attack is that they're just jerks and wanted to ruin this perfect day by setting the town on fire and killing everyone in sight. Even the special effects aren't very good. Whenever Farmer throws his boomerang, it's an obvious computer generated effect and several of the environments looks downright cheap. I'm not talking about the sets, which are decent enough. I'm talking about the wide shots with castles and such.

To the film's credit the Krugs and done with practical costumes and while their armor and weapons look cheap, at least they don't clash with the hapless villagers they're slaughtering. The elves (or whatever they are called, to my knowledge they were never named in the movie) are played by talented acrobats that do their own stunts. Hurray for faint praise! The fact that I had to re-watch part of the film to jog my memory brings me to the film's biggest flaw: it's too long and it's boring. This beast runs at slightly over two hours and there's just nothing here that will capture your interest. The characters barely have any personalities, the legions of opponents aren't menacing and their masters are one-dimensional. The battles are edited frenetically, meaning you're going to have a hard time figuring out who is winning and which character is dying when things get rough. It's really difficult to explain why the film is boring, but I can easily see people turning this one off before finishing it. It's Uwe Boll's shoddy direction that sinks what could have been at the very least a film that's so-bad-it's-good into an absolute bore to sit through.

Not even a reasonably big budget could save the curse of Uwe Boll. "In the Name of the King" proves itself to be a film that is utterly devoid of any fun moments, aside from a few action scenes where you can laugh at them ironically. It's absolutely terrible and I beg of you to stay away from it. (Theatrical version on DVD, January 24, 2014)

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: great actors, good film!!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Just die Uwe Boll
review_detailed_main: I unfortunately watched this movie thinking it would have been a faithful adaptation to the games I love. GOD AND PEOPLE SAY DUNGEON SIEGE 3 BAD. This film not only is completely unfaithful, but it also manages to rip off The Lord of the Rings. It has terrible effects, bad acting, a confusing plot the editing is out of order oh and IT HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE GAME oh wait the land is called Ebe THAT'S IT. Seriously who lets this guy make this movies they're a disgrace to the games they're based on. I'd give this a -10/10 if I could.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Bad
review_detailed_main:
What a waste of a movie. I like the facts the enemies are supposed to look like orcs from lotr but instead they look like cheap costumes. Cgi was bad writing was bad.

I can't believe how bad the writing was in this movie to the point where even legendary actors can't carry it. I bet this movie even ruined some of these actors that played in it.

Even if it's 2007 the cgi was horrible. It'd like boll tried to replicate lotr but with sub standard quality.

I don't know if boll is the sole reason for this massive flop but looking at his other movies I think it is. This man can't write a movie nor should be allowed to do it again.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A dull tedious pile of garbage

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Bollywood
review_detailed_main:
This was my first Uwe Boll movie. He's got a solid reputation as the world's worst director. And, indeed, the movie kicks of with this memorable dialogue between two lovers laying in bed:

She: I knew you'd come.

He: I told you I would.

Next, about the greatest cast of all times storms the silver screen. It's so great that Robert de Niro couldn't even get the role of 3.rd dungeon toilet cleaner's junior assistant despite sleeping with the director's mother. Those that made it include Burt Reynolds, Jason Statham, Ray Liotta, Ron Perlman ... those are my favourite four actors right there! What are they doing in this, to quote Bill Hicks, POS film? One marvels at the incredible cast, the cinematography, the scenery, the SFX, the action choreography and the stunts ... and trips over the nonexistent dialogue, the self-explanatory plot and the hammy one-take acting. And the blatant visual ripoffs from Lord Of The Rings and The Matrix. I don't think the actors had any lines, I think they were improvising. It must have been like: "Jason! You have just caught Norick rogering your wife, and a bunch of wolf-beings attack, and Leelee Sobieski's got a dizzy spell. And, action!"

Uwe Boll is basically a producer who also directs. I'm sure he's a unique kind of guy, somebody who feverishly loves movies, like Quentin Tarantino's evil twin. If he learns to handle dialogues better I'm sure that he'll make a great movie eventually. For now, Name Of The Kign is probably the greatest "schlocker" ever filmed.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: I thought this was a parody until I checked IMDB
review_detailed_main:
My goodness ne what a terrible movie! I honestly thought it was intended to be a Monty Python type movie and maybe I had confused it for a serious movie until I came o o n IMDB to check and seen that they were deadly serious - it's just terrible! I feel really sorry for the actors, some of these actors and actresses are incredibly talented but we're majorly let down by the director, screen writing and even the video editing was a disaster! I honestly don't think I've seen a movie that terrible before! This then see it cost them $60million to make?! My word! What a tragedy! Oh the things that money could have done for so many people in need and would have saved the actors/actresses their careers as well....

Absolutely shocking!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Bizarre
review_detailed_main:
This has to be the most disappointing movie ever. Great cast but third rate directing, editing ab and production. Almost thought it was a spoof of a real movie. Unfortunately it just sucks.

You keep watching waiting for it to get better and it just never does. The same amateur scenes just keep coming. You know from past performances that the cast (well most of them) can act. So how can every scene come off so (B) movie? Again bizarre is all I can say. Ray Liotta was so miss cast its almost comical if not so disappointing. He comes off like Ming in Flash Gordon.

So please don't waste the time.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Not Recommended.
review_detailed_main:
Browsing my netflix this film caught my eye, I enjoy a good fantasy film and it has some big names like Jason Statham. So I went in to this film hopeful. Right off the bat the music ruins the whole thing. It's desperately trying to create a mood but only ends up being jarring and off putting. The writing is abysmal. Some of the lines are cringe worthy. The costumes are hit and miss - some of the krug are good, but some, are terrible. The camera angles and special effects look rushed in some scenes (not sure what was happening there). I'm not completely sure how they convinced so many actors to star in this, or how they got the money to make it. I don't wish to blame any particular person for it, but someone somewhere had to have known how horribly wrong this was going.

Overall, I'd give it a miss. Unless you're playing drinking games. Might be good then.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: highly under rated
review_detailed_main: Firstly, what an absolutely amazing cast of quality and cult actors. The production values are high considering the moderate budget, the make up and effects are well done, the writing is decent and the action sequences are well choreographed. Admittedly it falls short of the lord of the rings (saying that, keep in mind, very few fantasy films could compete with LOTR, and this film didn't have the same budget and perhaps more importantly didn't have J.R.Tolken as a writer) but it certainly does its best, and at times even comes close! Personally i would happily rate this up there with classics like willow and dragonheart, and it is by far superior to the dungeons and dragons films which have been offered up. Frankly its sad this film hasn't achieved the cult status it deserves. well worth the watch if you're looking for an action fantasy film!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: In The Name Of The King is as "epic" as watching a blind amateur role-playing battle.
review_detailed_main: Sixty million dollars!? You give a sizeable budget like that to Uwe Boll? A director infamous worldwide for producing some of the worst films ever made? Unsurprisingly, this film is awful. Although, considering it is my first Boll experience, I was expecting much worse. A nearby village is attacked by Krugs where a farmer mounts a rescue mission to save the captured villagers and gain vengeance for the death of his son. Swords, magic, large scale battles, sorcerers, woodland women, ninjas, a CGI boomerang and a myriad of famous actors destroying their careers. Yes, you guessed it. It is a discounted version of 'Lord of the Rings' except it's an adaptation of a video game that hardly anyone played. Aside from Statham's standard stuntwork and Lillard's enjoyably campy performance, there is nothing to enjoy here. Everything about this production looks cheap. Authenticity ventured across the land, into another kingdom called "Middle Earth". All that remains is laziness. The houses look like plastic. The Krugs clearly resemble extras wearing 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle' costumes. Perlman is using hair gel in a middle aged kingdom. The protagonist is a farmer called Farmer. "He's taken two legions out of twelve!", "how many are left?", "...two thirds!". Boll loves filming a one-dimensional make out session. Liotta and Reynolds are unfathomably terrible, as two kings fighting for...something...I guess power? Look, the story was so basic that I simply switched my brain off and admired the passion that Boll attempted to inject. I mean, he tried bless him. But this isn't an eating competition where you get a pat on the back for giving it a good go. This. Is. Film critiquing! You don't get points for trying. He failed, miserably. After the final showdown, which has more swirling books than a library in a storm, the film ends. Done. Finished. No more. Two hours blurred into one gigantic mess. This is easily one of the worst video game adaptations and fantasy epics ever conceived by an individual who believes he makes good films.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Thin at best

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: ouch
review_detailed_main:
I'm sorry, but when I watch this movie it seems like children put it together. I have no problem with the over-all plot, just everything else. The costumes were bad, the script was bad and the directing was absolutely terrible. Not to mention the stupid camera tricks. Ray Liotta to me just seemed completely ridiculous. Who's fault that is I can't say, but I just know it was bad.

The only person I feel sorry for is Jason Statham (well and a little for Burt Reynolds. Contrary to popular belief I think he could play a good king). He made the best out of a bad movie. He's a great actor and I hope one day he gets his due. I'm a sucker for the fantasy type stuff, but this was just plain bad. The director, costume designer and probably the producer('s) should simply be ashamed of themselves. I've seen better directing in porn.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Here's the reason . . .
review_detailed_main:
I've never heard of this director - but it doesn't matter.

When you watch a movie like this, it's clear that whoever directed it was over-directing & too controlling. I felt like he stifled & didn't trust his actors. It felt like they were micro-managed.

The movie had great actors & great potential - Statham & a few of the other actors were excellent - but it was clear only they were carrying the movie with good acting.

And that was a miracle given the obvious poor direction.

This movie shows that the ability to act in spite of poor script/cheesy dialogue AND poor direction can be overcome - but even they can only carry so much.

The good actors can't do a thing about weaker actors who can't deal with bad direction, and the good actors can't do much about lighting & the cutting of the film, or the dumb, over-dramatic scenes the director is filming.

These directorial mishaps & poor cutting is why this film got the 3.8.

It's a real shame because again, this had a lot of potential.

Btw, the only vague similarity to Lord of the Rings - .is some fantasy magic, & an animal-like army.

Otherwise, it cannot even remotely be compared to an epic of that proportion & high caliber, which not only had amazing actors, but it EXCELLED in every facet of cinema from direction, wardrobe, locations, CGI, lighting, and more, beginning with an amazing author & story.

Back to THIS movie review - thumbs down.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Horrible!
review_detailed_main: Oh the horror! Horrible, laughable acting from all parties. Fight scenes were hideous. Special effects juvenile. Fifteen minutes of this were more than enough of this disaster!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Didn't know what I was in for
review_detailed_main:
Picked this movie out randomly on Netflix. Glad (or too bad) I didn't read reviews or ratings before hand because I definitely would have skipped it. This movies wasn't pure nonsense, but it was totally ridiculous. So many random actors, random accents, bad acting, absurd scenes of people swinging from vines in trees, cheesy hard to watch scenes, Matthew Lillard delivery highschool drama class level fight scenes... I gave up trying to take it seriously pretty early on and just gave in to hate watching it. It was the only way I could get through it.

If you don't like very crappy fantasy movies be sure to skip this one.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Why you should appreciate this movie

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Too Long And Cursed

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Can you hear that? That's the sound of 60 M dollars burning...
review_detailed_main:
My first experience with the "In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale" was in my youth. It was on TV and my father was watching, so I watched parts of it with him. It was weird, but I remember that I was impressed with action scenes, especially with the scene where a black man, a commander of some kind, fought while down in the mud, refusing to give up. Yesterday I decided to watch the full movie and not just the theatrical version, but the director's cut, with my friend. I was perfectly aware what kind of movie this is, but I love to watch bad movies, so I didn't hesitate one bit.

That this movie is really bad is something anyone can tell you. People mostly easily spot if something is good or bad. To explain why it is bad, is something that requires a bit more effort. To accomplish this, I'm going to split this review into multiple parts talking about different things. So, let's start.

PLOT: First, let's address the fact that this should be a video game adaptation. My experience with "Dungeon Siege" is fairly limited, but it's safe to say that the connections are minimal, except for the Farmer and name of the land and Krugs. With that out of the way, let's talk about plot. An evil wizard Gallian drains the power of young female wizard to become more stronger so he can rebel against the king with the help of the king's disloyal nephew. Our main character, simply called Farmer, is living a peaceful life right until the moment where he isn't. His son gets killed and his wife is kidnapped. Luckily, Farmer is an unkillable killing machine with plot armour thicker than dragon's hide and it's up to him to save the day. Without any more spoilers, that's basically it. It's basic, but it could serve it's purpose. Right? Well... Let's talk about acting a bit.

ACTING: Most of the actors are actually doing their best, but actors can only do so much when there's nobody competent to give them directions. Jason Statham, Ray Liotta, John Rhys-Davies, Brian White and Matthew Lillard really tried to do their job well and earn their pay or at least have fun, but Perlman, Reynolds and the rest are mostly awful. But again, talent doesn't matter when nobody knows how to use it and that brings us to the script.

SCRIPT: A lot of the script was rewritten late in the production because the whole thing was too similar to LOTR. That's should tell you all you need to know right of the bat. There's a lot of stupid stuff being spoken in this movie and some of it will leave you scratching your head with amazement that somebody actually wrote this and thought it looks good. Just wait until you hear the explanation to Farmer's origin, your mind will simply explode trying to understand what the author(s) of this script wanted to say. Moving on...

VISUALS: There is some beautiful nature shown in this movie and some cool visual effects, but they are rare. Costumes mostly look bad (though some of them reportedly cost 10 000 $ to make), helmets are visibly made out of plastic and the whole thing feels cheap while being anything but.

ACTION: Probably the saving grace of the movie, though not by much. Siu-Tung Ching worked as an action choreographer on this movie (his salary was higher than Boll's) and he really tried to make action in this movie look cool and to his credit, it is kind of cool, but here's the problem. When you take a man who specializes in making martial arts action movies and task him with making a fantasy action movie, you get this. Farmer is basically a martial artist, he runs on shoulders of his enemies, jumps around like crazy and kills anyone he fights with no trouble. There are ninjas in this movie just because Ching had talented people in his team. Yeah, he really didn't understand the concept. There are very dumb things in this movie. A battle takes place in the middle of the forest and archers shoot volleys of arrows even thought they would get stuck in the trees, Krugs (basically copy-pasted Uruk Hai's) sit into a catapult and get catapulted onto their enemy, they are thrown at their enemy with the help of giant slingshots and the final battle takes place at a hill and then the soldiers decide to go down, fighting their enemies on the slope instead on top of the hill. It's painfully stupid, but if you awake the kid inside yourself, you can enjoy it a bit. Also, the final battle tries really hard to copy the atmosphere and style of The Battle of Helm's Deep, even copying shots from the scene.

EDITING AND CINEMATOGRAPHY: The worst part of the movie by far. Kids in elementary school can edit videos better than this. A simple act of a man jumping is shown in 4 cuts! There is a lot of unnecessary cuts. A lot of them! And scenery is often in the way of action. Continuity doesn't exist. There is literally a scene where an army is marching and somebody decided to film the army walking on a path in front of which grew a large tree, so you can't see the whole army! It's almost as if this was edited by someone who doesn't know how a movie look like. This can somewhat be explained by the fact that first public cut of the movie was completed eight hours before screening, but still, it's unbelievably bad and drains even what little entertainment value remained in this mess.

MUSIC: Outro songs are great, rest is forgettable though passable and at moments even nice, clearly inspired by LOTR movies.

CONCLUSION: Look, it's so easy to blame everything on Uwe Boll, but I think this time it was not just him. It was everyone. What's done is done. In the end, "In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale" is a bad movie. It's watchable, has some entertainment value (though very little) and it's so bad that it warrants a single watch for you to see how a good fantasy movie shouldn't look. 4.5/10!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: When you get a change to make a film on a franchise Never ask Uwe Boll again please
review_detailed_main: This is one great example I wished only the trailer would exist. As promising as it looks from the beginning talking about art department. Creating the world of Dungeon siege. The moment the story takes place in the forest, no real attempts of recreating the world as it should be. Uwe Boll produced four feature-length movies in 2007. Instead of creating something solid, he rushed through this project on all levels of movie making. Stay far away from this movie there is so much more to see. For Uwe Boll, I'll advise him to take some movie classes. For the time being, I learned to stay away from any of his projects. Camera and Art department and sound design are kinda good. Story writing, editing, directing, Colour grading, soundtrack are all poorly executed. to me, Uwe Boll proved one thing he managed to have a great cast and made them look bad, one of the biggest sins you can do as a director. Jason Statham proves again his fighting skills are awesome, but he doesn't need this movie to prove it.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A Bunch of Guys Trying to Make The Lord of The Rings

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Great Film After Pizza and a LOT of Beer.
review_detailed_main:
Where do we begin? I saw this film on DVD with a few friends after some terrible Chinese pizza and a lot of good Chinese beer. We have seldom laughed harder or longer for most good comedies we have seen together. Why?

The script and casting is to die for. I mean every actor uttering every word in this film dies on screen; in an a mass suicide of actors uttering ridiculous dialog. Talk about being all over the place:

There is a Viking funeral, Ninja warriors, Merlinesque English magicians, a touch of Saturday Night Fever and Goodfellas with Ray Liotta,(absolutely hilarious casting here),a Lord of the Rings quest, a borrowed plot line from The 13th Warrior (men dressed up as Orcs),another hilarious idea to cast Burt Reynolds as an ancient king,(I was waiting to see Sally Field as the Queen and it would have been perfect), forest choreography similar to Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, and a bad imitation of Dennis Hopper by some second-rate actor.

Other than that, the film was completely believable.

The action sequences and production values were quite good; and fine for a video game. But this was supposed to be a movie with actors, direction, a plot, a script and a logical sequence. None of these are apparent in this turkey. But my friends and I had a grand old time lampooning just about every actor in every scene of this debacle. Just make sure you drink plenty of beer before you watch it.

Arthur H Tafero AskMrMovies.com Senior Reviewer

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Yawn! Better than Eragon...but not by much

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: My son worked as an extra on the film and that is not enough to make me want to watch it
review_detailed_main:
Awful is the only word for the film.

My son was an extra so I had to be on set while he was in the film. What I saw of the production that day did not inspire confidence the film would be at all decent. There was little no consideration being given to how the scenes should work or have continuity between takes

When we finally watched it when was screened here in Victoria and it was worse than I could have imagined. In some of the scenes I could see the problems with the continuity caused by no attention to any detail.

The plot is more or less missing for the movie which leaves you ask Why? most of the time.

Burt Reynolds as the king is so bad as to almost be funny.

The only actors that brought anything to the film were Jason Statham and Ron Perlman

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A surprisingly good adventure-fest
review_detailed_main: When I saw that this movie first, was inspired by a computer "role-playing" game, and, second, included Burt Reynolds as a supporting actor, I went in with low expectations. Those expectations were unfounded, and those two factors were both deceptive: the plot and characters were surprisingly well-crafted, and Reynolds put in what may be the performance of his career. (That may not be saying much, I'll admit, but it's something.) The acting all around is quite good, particularly at spots (most of them Ray Liotta's) where the action lent itself to over-the-top bravura but the performers opted for a more subtle approach. Some of the plot twists you can see a mile away, and others come out of nowhere, so while you know things are going to work out in the end the viewer can't be quite sure how it's going to get there. The only part I didn't care for, and that not by much, was seeing, without comment or explanation, two black men in charge of the army in what is clearly a society based on medieval Europe -- Brian J. White and Ron Selmour are both fantastic and deserving actors, but as out of place logistically speaking as the equally distracting lin-kuei (Chinese ninjas) who also serve in the King's army. Despite dead-on performances from both Reynolds and Leelee Sobieski, the film isn't going to win any Oscars, except maybe for the completely natural-looking visual effects or the dead-on costuming (lin-kuei notwithstanding), but it's definitely worth going to see.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: My type of movie
review_detailed_main: I liked it, not the type of film that's going to win a lot of Oscars but I found it very watchable. The other reviews that are giving it low marks are a little bit unfair maybe, basically if you like Rambo and rocky you'll like this and if you're more into titanic (I've not seen titanic) or Brigit Jones diary (not seen that either) then I'd say you'll turn this off after 5 minutes (as I did with both titanic and bjd). Ray Liotta gives the performance of his career which by itself is worth the rental money but there's more to the film than just that, as long as you don't take thing too seriuosly and you like action films with a limited story then this film is great, I wouldn't change a thing about it, apart from maybe on the DVD release they could've condensed all the Ray Liotta bits into one segment and have it as an option to just watch that, "you've won nothing but time".

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A Modern Masterpiece
review_detailed_main: When it comes to epic fantasy move over Lord Of The Rings here comes In The Name Of The King. Uwe Boll lets this film flow with beauty,grace and great storytelling. Jason Staham's acting as Farmer is academy award worthy also Uwe Boll's Direction is flawless. This film also is much to short i just wanted more. I know Uwe Boll has made crap like House Of The Dead and Alone In The Dark but this film is a flawless for 2 and a half hours. Another thing the cast is spectacular especially Jason Staham and Kristanna Loken who really should be in more films she is a wonderful actress. This film is probably the best film of the 21st century knocking of the previous best We Are Marshall. If you want to see a epic masterpiece see In The Name Of The King.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Don't listen to the negative comments - this movie ROCKS!!
review_detailed_main: It seems like people either love this movie or hate it. Well, you know what? I loved it! I don't care what anyone else says. The cast kicks butt - many of my favorite actors and actresses have been brought together. The characters and the plot are wonderful. My only two complaints are that the ending should have gone on for 5 or 10 more minutes and there was a part at the end that they should have changed. I won't be more specific so as not to give anything away. But, overall, FABULOUS!! The best way to know is to see for yourself. If you are a huge fan of castles and sorcery and swords and kings - you will definitely love this movie.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Really Well
review_detailed_main: all u are a bunch of hater,,this movie was really cool and awesome..great film but if u didn't like it thats ur fault..no taste...i enjoyed the film:),,jason was the best in the film...even though some of you guys make some points the movie was not a waste of time ..it was cool and fun... even though the comedy parts that u guys said were kinda true it was a 9 in my book out of ten..great actors and a great film..if you don't like films like in the name of the King then this was not for you so don't bother even writing about it..i did like it and it was worth a whole Sunday spent even took some family members to see it and they liked it too...in my book its really well

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Come on people just let yourself go just enjoy
review_detailed_main: OK so i came on here and saw the low rating this film had acquired and me being the huge Jason statham fan that i am i decided to read some of the reviews and the reviews had this movie down waaaay down on the to watch list but as i read on the reviews started to connect with one and other and the common theme at least in a lot of cases was that the reviewers seemed too all be how do i say of the academic type and by saying that I do mean the stuck up critic types who would go into a film such as this with their minds already made up and even possibly leave early and then they come on here and write reviews that have large words that i can only imagine what they might be compensating for non the less this immediately propelled this film to the top of the too watch list. So i watched it and i have to say Jason Statham you rock. OK that being said there are a few problems with this film Burt Reynolds although Im a fan he wasn't meant to play a king and then there is good ol ray some thought he was miss cast as well i think he did a fine job the costume designers on the other hand did not the story is typical and the action scenes in a couple brief moments it reminded me of when i was a kid watching power rangers yes i watched power rangers. So now your thinking well thats a lot of problems right well not for me it wasn't i was completely entertained i truly enjoyed this film i think Jason statham is phenomenal I cant help but root for him as a hero. But let me tell you this is one you definitely have to turn the brain off for just enjoy it .but this is a fare warning I am seriously easy to please when it comes too films I wish other could be too i think it would suck to have your enjoyment confined to a certain stable or type of film i count myself lucky I apologize for my spelling and punctuation etc and oh i didn't even quote poetry or use crazy large words and if i did I'm sure that i spelled incorrectly and or miss used them

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: for dungeon siege fans a MUST, for mediocre-fantasy fans recommended
review_detailed_main:
I decided to watch this movie even though, I first read all the negative user comments on this title. And now, after I have seen it, I'm more than glad that I have done so. As for the character selection, I have to agree with most of the other reviewers. Jason Statham is the best choice, the producers could have done. He plays his role, like he is born to Farmer! Also to have chosen Burt Reynolds as the king was a very good choice. He plays his role lovable. The only distracting thing was Ray Liotta, who plays his role very awful and the costumes of the kurg, which had something missing over it.

I, as a very big Dungeon Siege fan, must say that the movie totally lived up to my hopes. Many elements are similar to the original Dungeon Siege world, but sadly there are also some mad differences. But if you know that in forehand (and you should, because it's a typical Hollywood movie), you will enjoy an entertaining time. I can't agree with other reviewers that the movie takes all too long to watch. For me the movie was over like in an instant, so exiting was it! This movie is definitely on my "one day, I will watch this movie again, because it's so great"-list.

Now I'm very much hoping Uwe Boll will produce Dungeon Siege 2 and places the storyline exactly on the Dungeon Siege 2 computer game - that would be my movie wish of the year!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Great, very classic movie from Uwe
review_detailed_main: Saw this yesterday when Uwe was also in the cinema. I must admit that I had my reservations on this movie, concerning Uwes lack of success in the past. But this one blew me away. Great performance from all actors with great plot and great lines. Some even funny scenes, of which I hoped there would be more. After all it is a sincere movie with deep plots- classic plots like good versus evil, man- wife, father-son relationship, father-daughter relationship, David versus Goliath etc. With so many great actors it must have been awful to cut each one down to 2 hours of play time. What really shines is the camera, not a strength of Uwe in the past. A lot of Close Ups that put maximum attention on the stars ability to act. This was reminiscent to how films were made in the first half of the last century- more Ben Hur than LOTR to sum it up. Also a plus Battlefield scenes that look much more realistic than most battle scenes in LOTR. Full Force Jason Statham fights like never seen before. CGI was always great and some scenes were totally new. Uwe answered some questions even referring to a second installment if this movie does well with the box office results. Really liked his down to earth approach, he is a real film maniac who cares a lot about his audience. Wonder if Tarantino shows so much affection towards his clients...

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Awesome B Movie

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Great epic from Mr Boll
review_detailed_main: After reading comments in this column, I find it hard to believe they have seen the same movie as I have. Alright, Mr Boll have earlier made some lousy movies, but this has nothing to do with this movie. Give the man some credit, this time he has actually made a good movie. It is an epic action driven movie, the scenes are beautiful and even stunning at times, the script is well written, the camera work is quality work and the visuals are more than adequate. I even find the casting quite good, and to be honest I loved to see good old Burt Reynolds as King. In my opinion Ray Liotta is also perfect as the evil mage. A highly entertaining epic flick with a bunch competent actors and well directed, a movie I will enjoy watching again and again. If this is the new standard for future Uwe Boll movies, I look forward to his next movie. Thumbs up:)

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: A pretty nice movie!
review_detailed_main:
I really liked this one. I looked into the movie, and a couple scenes really just catched me. After that, I just kept watching. It's a one thing lead to another, with a variety of characters, and a medieval setting.

There are a lot of emotions that are visualized, that I really liked. The interaction, the banter inbetween the characters. The acting is very good. The story is simple, a one thing lead to another structure, built set by set, and such progresses throughout. It's a lot like a theatre play, but without it's limitations.

The fighting scenes are also pretty good, there is plenty of action. The actors are doing a very good job, they are obviously veterans. The characters and their interactions are done well. The settings and decorations are very good, rougher, more like how old movies used to be.

Overall, I really liked the movie.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Fantasy Classic.
review_detailed_main:
Jason Statham was a little bit of a fish out of water but held his own and the rest of the cast was brilliant (and I mean brilliant!). This was an excellent film that will be a staple of any fantasy movie collection. It was marred by some of the combat related effects (crouching tiger, hidden dragon crap - but it's only a few scenes) and a couple odds and ends barely worth mentioning (mostly post-production things like awkward scene changes that many won't even notice). While not campy like 'House of the Dead' Uwe Boll (director) has proved himself to be someone to watch for. This is a must buy for me, and I would check out anything with Boll's name on it now.

Too many people expected just another Statham action movie and others didn't go because they couldn't believe Statham in fantasy but where the former is simply a misplaced audience (and cranky about it), the latter has really missed out on an incredible fantasy movie.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Sword and sorcery
review_detailed_main: I expected some kind of violent fun movie, "Transporter" meets "Bloodrayne" or whatever, but it surprised me that "Dungeon Siege" has so much more class! The cast is extremely interesting: Burt Reynolds as the king and Rhys-Davies as the wizard have enormous screen presence in rather unusual roles, Forlani, Liotta and Statham would look good even if they only walked down the street, and Loken and Perlman are memorable supporters. Hiring Tony Ching to direct fast, elegant fight scenes was the icing on the cake. "Dungeon Siege" has a hero who isn't interested in saving the kingdom, he just minds his own business which only by accident becomes the same as saving the kingdom. That attitude keeps him with both feet on the ground with all the black magic around. This movie realized swords and sorcery are the most important ingredients for a sword and sorcery movie - I needn't point that out if it wasn't for too many films of the genre which failed here and thought it was about a princess falling in love or elves in nice spotless dresses discussing the burden of immortality.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: TEDDY FLIX REVIEWS -"In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale (2006)"
review_detailed_main: TEDDY FLIX REVIEWS -"In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale (2006)" -- This film was EPIC! RIVETING! DAZZLING TO THE SENSES! Director Uwe Boll threw in everything from numerous bloodless be- headings, Jason Statham's character, "Farmer", running across the shoulders of a dozen orc-like adversaries called Krugs, whom also voluntarily set themselves ablaze to be catapulted against The King, Burt Reynold's soldiers. The movie starts off just fine with brief scenes of the leading players in their respective scenarios: Liotta romancing Leelee with some sort of magical special effects going on; John Rhys-Davies (as a Magi and adviser to the King) sagely crying out "No!" as if it meant something; Statham, as a family man farming a field with his son when Perlman shows up as a friendly neighbor; Reynolds as the King and Matthew Lillard (doing his best to bring the 20th Century to the "middle ages time out of place" that is the setting for the film) as his cowardly / jealous of the throne Nephew. TWO THUMBS UP GO TO THE INTENSE BATTLE SCENES!! My favorite sequences consists of Krugs and fiery catapults, horses rearing up to crush opponents while being ridden by Wraiths controlled by Liotta's magic, gliding magical forest women riding vines like it's Xena meets Tarzan, only hotter chicks, and also the final duel between Statham and Liotta just ABSOLUTELY ROCKS! Teddy Flix say "5 stars baby ... nothing more, nothing less!" -- https://www.facebook.com/media/set/? set=a.10151901308699429.1073742285.518209428&type=1&l=1515b81720

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Much better than Lord of the Rings
review_detailed_main: This movie would have been a shoo-in for a 10 out of 10, but the vine-women knocked it down to a 9. First off, the cast was much higher caliber than LOTR's; John Rhys-Davies, Ray Liotta, Painkiller Jane, Burt Reynolds, Ron Perlman, Jason Statham, and the chick from Mallrats. I personally will take King Farmer over King Aragorn any day of the week, and John Rhys-Davies makes a better Gandalf than Magneto ever did. Only the most un-American terrorist-lover would set a movie in New Zealand when we have the beautiful Pacific Northwest right in our backyard. One highlight was Jason Statham's beautiful escape from being hung by twirling around while hanging from the noose and killing the guy and cutting the rope with one swing of the bad guy's sword (though the ladies in the audience will undoubtedly argue he never really escaped from being hung). This movie also puts books firmly back in their rightful place as the weapons of villains, which was a move that was long coming. I can only wait and hope that the next two movies are picked up to top off the trilogy.

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: This movie was totally awesome!
review_detailed_main: I don't understand all the bad reviews on this movie. I thought it was a great epic! I loved everything about it! I love Jason Statham! I did not watch this movie with the intent to compare it to any other movie of its type, which would be unfair. I did not see the Lord of the Rings movies, which I'm sure were totally awesome but, then, why wouldn't they be, all things considered. This movie had everything I was looking for in this type of movie: great movie stars, action, romance, a little humor, beautiful cinematography, wizardry, and a happy ending! If you are looking to be entertained, and not compare it to other movies of this type, you won't be disappointed!

movie_name: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale
review_title: Loved It
review_detailed_main: While neither original or inspired I loved this movie. It was exactly what it was supposed to be. In the Name of the King was based off a game that I liked playing. It translated well to the big screen.
